It would be good, Blessed One, if the Blessed One would allow

translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: kim puna vayam sāmam eva keśān otārayitvā kāṣāyāni vastrāṇi ācchādayitvā kośaka ābaddhehi yāne

“If the Fortunate One will allow it,
we will go forth, if he will not allow it,

translated: And now the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One has appeared in the world, and the Dharma is taught, which leads to peace, to complete Nirvāṇa, is proclaimed by the Well-Gone One, for the attainment of immortality,
leads to the realization of nirvana.
It would be good, Blessed One, if women

analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān mahāprajāpatīm gautamīm etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to Mahaprajapati Gautami:

analyzed: mā te gautamī rocatu mātṛgrāmasya tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye pravrajyā upasampadā bhikṣuṇi bhāvaḥ

Then indeed, Mahaprajapati Gautami,

analyzed: na khalu bhagavān avakāśam karoti mātṛgrāmasya tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye pravrajyām jyāya  upasampadām dāya
translated: the Blessed One does not allow women to go forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya,

analyzed: bhikṣuṇi bhāvasya iti  sā bhagavataḥ pādām śirasā vanditvā jetavanasya

analyzed: samīpe rodamānī asthāsi pādāṇguṣṭhena bhūmim vilikhantī
translated: she stood crying, scratching the ground with her big toe.

original: addaśāśi khu anyataro bhikṣur mahāprajāpatīṃ gautamīṃ jetavanasya ārāmadvārakoṣṭhasamīpe rudamānīn tiṣṭhantīṃ pādāṅguṣṭhena bhūmiṃ vilikhentīṃ

translated: A certain monk saw Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī standing at the door of the Jeta Grove courtyard, weeping and scratching the ground with her big toe.

translated: Go, Venerable Ānanda, and find out why Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī is weeping.

Gautamī, why are you weeping?

original: evam ukte mahāprajāpatī gautamī āyuṣmantam ānandam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte mahāprajāpatī gautamī āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī said to the Venerable Ānanda:

translated: Enough, Venerable Ānanda, with my weeping. For such an appearance of a Buddha is rare, and such a teaching of the true Dharma is rare.

original: bhagavāṃś caitarhi loke utpanno tathāgato 'rhan samyaksambuddho dharmo deśīyati aupasamiko pārinirvāṇiko sugatapravedito amṛtasya prāptaye
analyzed: bhagavān ca etarhi loke utpannaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksambuddhaḥ dharmaḥ deśīyati aupasamikaḥ pārinirvāṇikaḥ sugata praveditaḥ amṛtasya prāptaye
translated: And now the Blessed One has arisen in the world, a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One, the Dharma is being taught, conducive to calming, leading to complete awakening, revealed by the Well-Gone One, leading to the attainment of Nibbāna,
leading to the realization of Nibbāna.

original: na ca bhagavān avakāśaṃ karoti mātṛgrāmasya tathāgatapravedite dharmavinaye pravrajyāyopasampadāya bhikṣuṇībhāvasya ścai sādhu tāvāryānanda
analyzed: na ca bhagavān avakāśam karoti mātṛgrāmasya tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye pravrajyāya upasampadāya bhikṣuṇī bhāvasya sādhu tau ārya ānanda
translated: But the Blessed One does not allow women to go forth in the well-proclaimed Dhamma and Discipline, to shave off their hair and beard, don saffron robes, and commit themselves to the practice of the spiritual life. It would be good, Noble Ānanda,

original: bhagavantaṃ yāca yathā labheya mātṛgrāmo pi tathāgatapravedite dharmavinaye pravrajyām upasampadāṃ bhikṣuṇībhāvaṃ /
analyzed: bhagavantam yāca yathā labheya tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye pravrajyām upasampadām bhikṣuṇī bhāvam
translated: if you would request the Blessed One to allow women to go forth in the well-proclaimed Dhamma and Discipline, to shave off their hair and beard, don saffron robes, and commit themselves to the practice of the spiritual life.

original: sādhu gautamīti āyuṣmān ānando mahāprajāpatīye gautamīye pratiśrutvā yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkramitvā bhagavataḥ pādauśirasā vanditvā ekānte
analyzed: sādhu gautami iti āyuṣmān ānandaḥ mahāprajāpatīye gautamīye pratiśrutvā yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkramitvā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte
translated: Very well, Gautamī, the venerable Ānanda replied to Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī. He approached the Blessed One, bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet, and stood to one side.
He said this:

original: ekāntasthito āyuṣmān ānando bhagavantam etad avocat durlabho bhagavan buddhotpādo durlabhā saddharmadeśanā bhagavān cetarhi loke utpannānno
analyzed: ekānta sthitaḥ āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat durlabhaḥ bhagavan buddha utpādaḥ durlabhā saddharma deśanā bhagavān ca itarhi loke utpannāt no
translated: Standing to one side, the Venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, it is rare for a Buddha to appear, it is rare for the teaching of the true Dharma to be given. And now, Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One has appeared in the world,

original: tathāgato'rhan samyaksambuddho dharmo ca deśyate aupasamiko pārinirvāṇiko sugatapravedito amṛtasya prāptaye nirvāṇasya sākṣātkriyāyai samvartati
analyzed: tathāgataḥ ūrhan samyaksambuddhaḥ dharmaḥ ca deśyate aupasamikaḥ pārinirvāṇikaḥ sugata praveditaḥ amṛtasya prāptaye nirvāṇasya sākṣātkriyāyai samvartati
translated: and the Dharma is being taught, which leads to peace, to complete Nirvāṇa, is proclaimed by the Well-Gone One, and leads to the attainment of deathlessness, to the realization of Nirvāṇa.
It would be good, Blessed One,

original: mātṛgrāmo pi labheya tathāgatapravedite dharmavinaye pravrajyām upadampadāṃ bhikṣuṇibhāvaṃ /
analyzed: labheya tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye pravrajyām upadampadām bhikṣuṇi bhāvam
translated: if women could obtain going forth and full ordination in the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathāgata, the state of a bhikṣuṇī.

original: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Ānanda:

original: mā te gautamīmātā rocatu mātṛgrāmasya tathāgatapravedite dharmavinaye pravrajyāmupasampadāṃdā
analyzed: mā te gautamī mātā rocatu mātṛgrāmasya tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye pravrajyām upasampadāṃdā
translated: Gautamī, your mother, should not delight in women going forth and receiving full ordination in the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathāgata,
in the state of a bhikṣuṇī.
Then, the Venerable Ānanda,

original: bhagavān nāvakaśaṃ karoti mātṛgrāmasya tathāgata pravedite dharmavinaye pravrajyāupasaṃpadāye bhikṣuṇībhāvasyeti /
analyzed: bhagavān na avakaśam karoti mātṛgrāmasya tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye pravrajyā upasaṃpadāye bhikṣuṇī bhāvasya iti
translated: thinking The Blessed One does not allow women to go forth and receive full ordination in the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathāgata, in the state of a bhikṣuṇī,

original: bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā yena mahāprajāpati gautamī tenopasaṃkramitvā mahāprajāpatīṃ gautamīm etad avocat /
analyzed: bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā yena mahāprajāpati gautamī tena upasaṃkramitvā mahāprajāpatīm gautamīm etat avocat
translated: Having bowed her head at the Blessed One's feet, she approached Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī and said this:

original: na khalu gautamī bhagavān avakāśaṃ karoti mātṛgrāmasya tathāgatapravedite dharmavinaye pravrajyāyopasaṃpadāya bhikṣuṇībhāvāya /
analyzed: na khalu gautamī bhagavān avakāśam karoti mātṛgrāmasya tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye pravrajyāya upasaṃpadāya bhikṣuṇī bhāvāya
translated: Gautamī, the Blessed One does not allow for women to go forth from the household life into homelessness in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: evam ukte mahāprajāpatī gautamī āyuṣmantam ānandam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte mahāprajāpatī gautamī āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī said to the venerable Ānanda:

original: sādhu tāvāryānanda dvitīyaṃ pi bhagavantaṃ yāca yathā mātṛgrāmo pi labheya tathāgatapravedite dharmavinaye pravrajyāṃ upasaṃpadāṃ bhikṣuṇībhāvaṃ
analyzed: sādhu tau ārya ānanda dvitīyam pi bhagavantam yāca yathā labheya tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye pravrajyām upasaṃpadām bhikṣuṇī bhāvam
translated: Well then, Āryan Ānanda, please request the Blessed One a second time, so that women may obtain going forth from the household life into homelessness, higher ordination, and the state of a bhikkhunī in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: sādhu gautamīti āyuṣmān ānando dvitīyaṃ pi mahāprajāpatīye gautamīye pratiśrutvā yena bhagavān tenopasaṃkramitvā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā
analyzed: sādhu gautami iti āyuṣmān ānandaḥ dvitīyam mahāprajāpatīye gautamīye pratiśrutvā yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkramitvā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā
translated: Very well, Gautamī, the venerable Ānanda replied for a second time to Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī. He approached the Blessed One, bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet,
and stood to one side.

original: ekānte sthito āyuṣmān ānando bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: ekānte sthitaḥ āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: While standing to one side, the venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One:

original: durlabho bhagavan buddhotpādo ti tad evaṃ sarvaṃ yāca yāva
analyzed: durlabhaḥ bhagavan buddha utpādaḥ ti tat evam sarvam yāca yāva
translated: Rare, Blessed One, is the appearance of a Buddha, therefore, may all be allowed to go forth, up to the state of a nun.

original: bhikṣuṇībhāvo ti evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etad avocat /
analyzed: bhikṣuṇī bhāvaḥ ti evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to the venerable Ānanda:

original: māte gautamī mātā rocatu mātṛgrāmasya tathāgatapravedite dharmavinaye pravrajyā upasaṃpadā bhikṣuṇībhāvo /
analyzed: māte gautamī mātā rocatu mātṛgrāmasya tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye pravrajyā upasaṃpadā bhikṣuṇī bhāvaḥ
translated: Let the mother Gautami be allowed, let the going forth, the higher ordination, the state of a nun be allowed for women in the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathāgata.

original: saṃyathāpi nāmānanda sampanne yavakaraṇe ca kāraṇḍavaṃ nāma rogarājā ti upanipateya evan taṃ sampannaṃ yavakaraṇaṃ mahatā upakleśena upakliṣṭaṃ
analyzed: saṃyathā api nāma ānanda sampanne yavakaraṇe ca kāraṇḍavam nāma roga rājā upanipateya evam tam sampannam yavakaraṇam mahatā upakleśena upakliṣṭam
translated: Just as, Ānanda, when a barley field is abundant, the king of diseases named Karanda would attack it, and that abundant barley field would be afflicted with a great calamity,

original: bhavati evam eva gautamī mātā yasmin prāvacane mātṛgrāmo pi labhati pravrajyām upasaṃpadāṃ bhikṣuṇībhāvaṃ evan taṃ prāvacanaṃ mahatāmupakleśena 🔽upakliṣṭaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: bhavati evam eva gautamī mātā yasmin prāvacane mātṛgrāmaḥ u pi labhati pravrajyām upasaṃpadām bhikṣuṇī bhāvam evam tam prāvacanam mahatām upakleśena  upakliṣṭam bhavati
translated: in the same way, Gautami, when in this teaching women are allowed to go forth, to be ordained, to become nuns, that teaching would be afflicted with a great calamity.

original: sayyathāpi nāma gautamī mātā sampanne ikṣukaraṇe mañjiṣṭhā nāma rogarājā ti evan taṃ sampannaṃ ikṣukaraṇam mahatā upakleśena upakliṣṭam
analyzed: sayyathā api nāma gautamī mātā sampanne ikṣu karaṇe mañjiṣṭhā nāma roga rājā evan tam sampannam ikṣu karaṇam mahatā upakleśena upakliṣṭam
translated: Just as, Gautami, when a sugarcane field is abundant, the king of diseases named Mañjiṣṭhā would attack it, and that abundant sugarcane field would be afflicted with a great calamity,

original: evam eva gautamī mātā yasmin prāvacane mātṛgrāmo pi labhati pravrajyām upasaṃpadāṃ bhikṣuṇībhāvaṃ evan taṃ prāvacanam mahatā upakleśena upakliṣṭam
analyzed: evam eva gautamī mātā yasmin prāvacane mātṛgrāmaḥ u pi labhati pravrajyām upasaṃpadām bhikṣuṇī bhāvam evam tam prāvacanam mahatā upakleśena upakliṣṭam
translated: In the same way, Gautami, the mother, in which instruction women receive going forth, full ordination, and the state of a bhikshuni, that instruction is greatly afflicted by afflictions.
It becomes

original: sayyathāpi nāma mā te gautamī mātā rocatu mātṛgrāmasya tathāgatapravedite dharmavinaye pravrajyāmupasaṃpadāṃ dā
analyzed: sayyathā api nāma mā te gautamī mātā rocatu mātṛgrāmasya tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye pravrajyām upasaṃpadām dā
translated: Just as, Gautami, your mother does not approve of women going forth in the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathagata,
receiving full ordination and the state of a bhikshuni.
Then indeed the Venerable Ananda,

original: bhagavān nā vakāśaṃ karoti mātṛgrāmasya tathāgatapravedite dharmavinaye pravrajyāyopasaṃpadāya bhikṣuṇībhāvasyeti /
analyzed: bhagavān nā avakāśam karoti mātṛgrāmasya tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye pravrajyāya upasaṃpadāya bhikṣuṇī bhāvasya iti
translated: the Blessed One does not allow women to go forth in the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathagata, to receive full ordination and the state of a bhikshuni.

original: yena mahāprajāpatī gautamī tenopasaṃkramitvā mahāprajāpatīṃ gautamīṃ etad avocat /
analyzed: yena mahāprajāpatī gautamī tena upasaṃkramitvā mahāprajāpatīm gautamīm etat avocat
translated: He approached Mahaprajapati Gautami and said this to Mahaprajapati Gautami:

original: na khalu gautamī bhagavān avakāśaṃ karoti mātṛgrāmasya tathāgatapravedite dharmavinaye pravrajyāyopasaṃpadāya bhikṣuṇībhāvasyeti /
analyzed: na khalu gautamī bhagavān avakāśam karoti mātṛgrāmasya tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye pravrajyāya upasaṃpadāya bhikṣuṇī bhāvasya iti
translated: Gautami, indeed the Blessed One does not allow women to go forth in the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathagata, to receive full ordination and the state of a bhikshuni.

original: evam ukte mahāprajāpatī gautamī āyuṣmantam ānandam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte mahāprajāpatī gautamī āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the great elder Gautami said this to the Venerable Ananda:

original: sādhu tāvāryānanda tṛtīyaṃ pi bhagavantaṃ yāca yathā mātṛgrāmo pi labheya tathāgatapravedite dharmavinaye pravrajyām upasaṃpadaṃ bhikṣuṇībhāvaṃ
analyzed: sādhu tau ārya ānanda tṛtīyam pi bhagavantam yāca yathā labheya tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye pravrajyām upasaṃpadam bhikṣuṇī bhāvam
translated: Good, noble Ananda, for the third time ask the Blessed One so that women may be allowed to go forth in the well-proclaimed Dhamma and Discipline, to be fully admitted into the homeless life.

original: sādhu gautamītī āyuṣmān ānando tṛtīyaṃ pi mahāprajāpatīya gautamīya pratiśrutvā yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkramitvā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā
analyzed: sādhu āyuṣmān ānandaḥ tṛtīyam mahāprajāpatīya gautamīya pratiśrutvā yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkramitvā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā
translated: Good, Gautami, the Venerable Ananda replied for the third time to the great elder Gautami. He approached the Blessed One, bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet,

original: ekānte niṣīdi ekāntaniṣaṇṇo āyuṣmān ānando bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: ekānte niṣīdi ekānta niṣaṇṇaḥ āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: and sat down to one side. Sitting to one side, the Venerable Ananda said this to the Blessed One:

original: purimakānāṃ bhagavan tathāgatānām arhatāṃ samyaksambuddhānāṃ kati parṣāyo abhuvan /
analyzed: purimakānām bhagavan tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksambuddhānām kati
translated: Blessed One, how many assemblies did the Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One of the past have?

original: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to the Venerable Ananda:

original: purimakānām ānanda tathāgatānām arhatāṃ samyaksambuddhānāṃ catvāri pariṣāyo abhuvan sayyathīdaṃ /
analyzed: purimakānām ānanda tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksambuddhānām catvāri abhuvan
translated: Ananda, the Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One of the past had four assemblies, namely:
monks, nuns, male lay followers, and female lay followers.

original: evam ukte āyuṣmān ānando bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Ānanda said this to the Fortunate One:

original: ye ime bhagavan catvāro śrāmaṇyaphalā sayyathīdaṃ śrotaāpattiphalaṃ sakṛdāgāmiphalam anāgāmiphalam agraphalam arhatvaṃ /
analyzed: ye ime bhagavan catvāraḥ sayyathī idam śrotaāpatti phalam sakṛdāgāmi phalam anāgāmi phalam agra phalam arha tvam
translated: These four fruits of asceticism, Fortunate One, namely: the fruit of stream-entry, the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, and the supreme fruit of asceticism, the state of an Arhat.

original: bhavyo eteṣāṃ mātṛgrāmo pi eko 'pramatto ātāpi vyupakṛṣṭo viharanto sākṣīkartuṃ /
analyzed: bhavyaḥ eteṣām mātṛgrāmaḥ pi ekaḥ pramattaḥ vyupakṛṣṭaḥ viharantaḥ sākṣīkartum
translated: Is it possible for a woman, having gone forth, to actualise these?

original: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Fortunate One said this to the Venerable Ānanda:

original: yānīmāni ānanda catvāri śrāmaṇyaphalāni sayyathīdaṃ śrotaāpattiphalaṃ yāvad agraphalam arhatvaṃ /
analyzed: yāni imāni ānanda catvāri śrāmaṇya phalāni sayyathī idam śrotaāpatti phalam yāvat agra phalam arhatvam
translated: These four fruits of asceticism, Ānanda, namely: the fruit of stream-entry, up to the supreme fruit of asceticism, the state of an Arhat.

original: bhavyo eteṣāṃ matṛgrāmo pi eko 'pramatto ātāpi vyupakṛṣṭo viharanto sākṣīkartuṃ /
analyzed: bhavyaḥ eteṣām matṛgrāmaḥ pi ekaḥ pramattaḥ vyupakṛṣṭaḥ viharantaḥ sākṣīkartum
translated: It is possible for a woman, having gone forth, to actualise these.

original: evam ukte āyuṣmān ānando bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Ānanda said this to the Fortunate One:

original: yato khalu bhagavan purimakānāṃ tathāgatānām arhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ catvāro parṣāyo abhūṃsuḥ bhikṣubhikṣuṇī upāsakopāsikā /
analyzed: yatas khalu bhagavan purimakānām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām catvāraḥ parṣāyaḥ abhūṃsuḥ bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikā
translated: Since, Fortunate One, the four assemblies of the former Realised Ones, Worthy and Perfect Buddhas were: monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen.
And these four fruits of asceticism, namely:

analyzed: śrotaāpatti phalam agra phalam arha tvam
translated: The fruit of stream-entry up to the highest fruit of arhatship.

original: bhavyo eteṣāṃ mātṛgrāmo pi eko apramatto ātāpi vyupakṛṣṭo viharanto sākṣīkartuṃ /
analyzed: bhavyaḥ eteṣām mātṛgrāmaḥ pi ekaḥ apramattaḥ vyupakṛṣṭaḥ viharantaḥ sākṣīkartum
translated: A woman, if she is diligent, ardent, and restrained, is capable of realizing these.

original: sādhu bhagavan mātṛgrāmo pi labheya tathāgatapravedite dharmavinaye pravrajyām upasaṃpadāṃ bhikṣuṇībhāvaṃ /🔽duṣkaracākā
analyzed: sādhu bhagavat labheya tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye pravrajyām upasaṃpadām bhikṣuṇī bhāvam  duṣkara cākā
translated: Blessed One, it would be good if women could obtain going forth, full ordination, and the state of a bhikkhunī in the well-proclaimed Dhamma and Discipline.

original: rikā ca bhagavato mahāprajāpatī gautamī āppā
analyzed: rikā ca bhagavataḥ mahāprajāpatī gautamī āppā
translated: The Blessed One's mother, Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī, was a doer of what is hard,

original: yikā poṣikā janetrīye kālagatāye stanyasya dāyikā bhagavāṃś ca kṛtajño kṛtavedī /
analyzed: yikā poṣikā janetrīye kālagatāye stanyasya dāyikā bhagavān ca kṛtajñaḥ kṛta vedī
translated: a wet-nurse, a foster-mother, and when the Blessed One's mother passed away, she gave him milk to drink. The Blessed One is grateful and thankful.

original: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda:

original: evam etad ānanda duṣkarakārikā ānanda tathāgatasya mahāprajāpatī gautamī āpāyikā poṣikā janetriye kālagatāye stanyasya dāyikā tathāgato ca
analyzed: evam etat ānanda duṣkara kārikā ānanda tathāgatasya mahāprajāpatī gautamī āpāyikā poṣikā janetriye stanyasya dāyikā ca
translated: So it is, Ānanda, Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī was a doer of what is hard for the Tathāgata, a wet-nurse, a foster-mother, and when the Tathāgata's mother passed away, she gave him milk to drink. The Tathāgata is
grateful and thankful.

original: api cānanda tathāgato pi mahāprajāpatīya gautamīya duṣkarakārako /
analyzed: api ca ānanda tathāgataḥ pi mahāprajāpatīya gautamīya duṣkara kārakaḥ
translated: Moreover, Ānanda, the Tathāgata is also a doer of what is hard for Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī.

original: tathāgataṃ hy ānandāāgamya mahāprajāpatī gautamī buddhaśaraṇaṃ gatā /
analyzed: tathāgatam hi ānandāḥ āgamya mahāprajāpatī gautamī buddha śaraṇam gatā
translated: For, Ānanda, because of the Tathāgata, Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī has gone for refuge to the Buddha,
she has gone for refuge to the Dharma,

original: saṃghaśaraṇaṃ gatā tathāgataṃ hy ānandāgamya mahāprajāpatī gautamī
analyzed: saṃgha śaraṇam gatā tathāgatam hi ānanda āgamya mahāprajāpatī gautamī
translated: For, Ānanda, because of the Tathāgata, Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī,
for as long as she lives, has abstained from killing living beings,

original: yāvajjīvaṃ adattādānāt prativiratā 🔽yāvajjīvaṃ kāmeṣu mithyācārāt prativiratā
analyzed: yāvajjīvam a datta ādānāt prativiratā  yāvajjīvam kāmeṣu mithyā ācārāt prativiratā
translated: for as long as she lives, has abstained from taking what has not been given,🔽for as long as she lives, has abstained from sexual misconduct,
for as long as she lives, has abstained from false speech,
for as long as she lives, has abstained from drinking alcohol, which is a basis for negligence.

original: tathāgataṃ hy ānandāgamya mahāprajāpatī gautamī śraddhayā vardhati /
analyzed: tathāgatam hi ānanda āgamya mahāprajāpatī gautamī śraddhayā vardhati
translated: For, Ānanda, because of the Tathāgata, Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī's faith has increased,

original: śīlena vardhati śrutena vardhati tyāgena vardhati /
analyzed: śīlena vardhati śrutena vardhati tyāgena vardhati
translated: her morality has increased, her learning has increased, her generosity has increased,
her wisdom has increased.

original: tathāgataṃ hy ānandāgamya mahāprajāpatī gautamī duḥkhaṃ jānāti samudayaṃ jānāti /
analyzed: tathāgatam hi ānanda āgamya mahāprajāpatī gautamī duḥkham jānāti samudayam jānāti
translated: For, Ānanda, because of the Tathāgata, Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī knows suffering, knows its arising,
knows its cessation,
knows the path,

original: yaṃ ānanda pudgalo pudgalam āgamya buddhaṃ śaraṇaṃ gacchati /
analyzed: yam ānanda pudgalaḥ pudgalam āgamya buddham śaraṇam gacchati
translated: Ānanda, when a person, because of another person, goes for refuge to the Buddha,
goes for refuge to the Dharma,
goes for refuge to the Saṅgha.

original: iminā ānanda pudgalena imasya pudgalasya na supratikaraṇaṃ bhavati yāvajjīvaṃ pi na upasthiheya yad uta cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkārehi
analyzed: iminā ānanda pudgalena imasya pudgalasya na su pratikaraṇam bhavati yāvajjīvam na upasthiheya yat uta cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārehi
translated: This person, Ānanda, has not done a good turn for this person, and should not be attended upon for as long as he lives, namely with robes, almsfood, dwellings, and medicinal supplies for the sick.
In this way also it is not a good turn.

original: yaṃ ānanda pudgalo pudgalam āgamya yāvajjīvaṃ prāṇātipātāto prativiramati /
analyzed: yam ānanda pudgalaḥ pudgalam āgamya yāvajjīvam prativiramati
translated: Ānanda, that person for whose sake a person, for as long as he lives, refrains from killing living creatures,

original: yāvajjīvaṃ adattādānāto prativiramati /🔽yāvajjīvaṃ kāmeṣu mithyācārāt prativiramati /🔽yāvajjīvaṃ mṛṣāvādāto prativiramati /
analyzed: yāvajjīvam prativiramati  yāvajjīvam kāmeṣu mithyā ācārāt prativiramati  yāvajjīvam prativiramati
translated: for as long as he lives refrains from taking what has not been given,🔽for as long as he lives refrains from sexual misconduct,🔽for as long as he lives refrains from false speech,

original: yāvajjīvaṃ surāmaireyamadyapānāto prativiramati /🔽iminā pudgalena imasya paupu
translated: for as long as he lives refrains from drinking alcohol, wines, or liquors which cause heedlessness.
This person, Ānanda, has not done a good turn for this person,
and should not be attended upon for as long as he lives.

analyzed: yat uta cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārehi
translated: Namely with robes, almsfood, dwellings, and medicinal supplies for the sick.
In this way also it is not a good turn.

original: yaṃ ānanda pudgalo pudgalam āgamya śraddhayā vardhati śīlena śrutena tyāgena prajñayā vardhati /
analyzed: yam ānanda pudgalaḥ pudgalam āgamya śraddhayā vardhati śīlena śrutena tyāgena prajñayā vardhati
translated: Ānanda, if a person, on account of another person, increases in faith, morality, learning, generosity, and wisdom,

original: iminānanda pudgalena imasya pudgalasya na supratikaraṃ bhavati /
analyzed: iminā ānanda pudgalena imasya pudgalasya na su pratikaram bhavati
translated: it is not easy for this person to repay this person,

original: yāvajjīvaṃ pi na upasthiheya yad uta cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkārehi /
analyzed: yāvajjīvam naḥ upasthiheya yat uta cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārehi
translated: even if he were to follow him for a lifetime with material gifts such as robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicinal supplies for curing the sick.

original: evaṃ pi se na supratikāram bhavati /
analyzed: evam pi se na su pratikāram bhavati
translated: In this way also it is not easy to repay.

analyzed: yam ānanda pudgalaḥ pudgalam āgamya duḥkham jānāti samudayam jānāti nirodham jānāti mārgam ca jānāti
translated: Ānanda, if a person, on account of another person, knows suffering, knows origination, knows cessation, and knows the path,

original: iminā ānanda pudgalena imasya pudgalasya na supratikāram bhavati /
analyzed: iminā ānanda pudgalena imasya pudgalasya na su pratikāram bhavati
translated: it is not easy for this person to repay this person,

translated: even if he were to follow him for a lifetime with material gifts such as robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicinal supplies for curing the sick.

translated: In this way also it is not easy to repay.

original: pasampannāye ānanda bhikṣuṇīye tadahopasampannasya bhikṣusya śirasā pādā vanditavyā /
analyzed: ānanda bhikṣuṇīye tat aha upasampannasya bhikṣusya śirasā pādāḥ vanditavyāḥ
translated: For a nun who has been fully ordained for a hundred years, she should pay respect with her head at the feet of a monk who has been fully ordained that very day.

original: ayam ānanda bhikṣuṇīnāṃ prathamo gurudharmo yo bhikṣūṇīhi yāvajjīvaṃ satkartavyo yāva anatikramaṇīyo velāmiva mahāsamudreṇa //

translated: This, Ānanda, is the first weighty rule for nuns, which should be respected by nuns as long as life lasts, and should not be transgressed against, just as the ocean is deep, vast, immeasurable, and unfathomable.
weighty rule

translated: This, Ānanda, is the second weighty rule for nuns, which should be respected by nuns as long as life lasts, and should not be transgressed against, just as the ocean is deep, vast, immeasurable, and unfathomable.
weighty rule

original: āvaḍḍo ānanda bhikṣuṇīnāṃ bhikṣuṣu vacanapatho bhūtena vā abhūtena vā anāvaḍḍo bhikṣusya bhikṣuṇīṣu vacanapatho bhūtena no abhūtena /
analyzed: āvaḍḍaḥ ānanda bhikṣuṇīnām bhikṣuṣu vacana pathaḥ bhūtena vā abhūtena vā an āvaḍḍaḥ bhikṣusya bhikṣuṇīṣu vacana pathaḥ bhūtena no abhūtena
translated: Ānanda, for nuns there is no reprimanding of monks, whether it is true or not. For monks there is a reprimand of nuns, whether it is true or not.

original: ayam ānanda bhikṣuṇīnāṃ tṛtīyo gurudharmo yo bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvaṃ satkartavyo vistareṇa //

translated: This, Ānanda, is the third important rule for the nuns, which the nuns should train in for life.
Important rule

original: bhaktāgraṃ śayyāsanaṃ vihāro ca bhikṣuṇīhi bhikṣuto sādayitavyo /
analyzed: bhakta agram śayyā āsanam vihāraḥ ca bhikṣuṇīhi bhikṣutaḥ sādayitavyaḥ
translated: The nuns should accept the best alms-food, the best bed and bench, and the best lodging from the monks.

analyzed: ayam ānanda caturthaḥ guru dharmaḥ yaḥ bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvam satkartavyaḥ gurukartavyaḥ vistareṇa
translated: This, Ānanda, is the fourth important rule for the nuns, which the nuns should train in for life.
Important rule

original: gurudharmāpannāye ānanda bhikṣuṇīye ardhamāsam bhikṣuṇīsaṃghe mānatvaṃ yācitavyaṃ ubhayato saṃghe ca āhvayanaṃ /

translated: Ānanda, a nun who has committed an important rule should request probation for half a month from the community of nuns and the community of monks.

original: ayam ānanda paṇcamo bhikṣuṇīnāṃ gurudharmo yo bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvaṃ satkartavyo vistareṇa //
analyzed: ayam ānanda paṇcamaḥ bhikṣuṇīnām guru dharmaḥ yaḥ bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvam satkartavyaḥ vistareṇa
translated: This, Ānanda, is the fifth important rule for the nuns, which the nuns should train in for life.

analyzed: guru dharma  anvārdha māsam bhikṣuṇīhi bhikṣu saṃgha itghāt
translated: Important rule
Every half month the nuns should request the observance day ceremony and the exhortation from the community of monks.

original: ayam ānanda bhikṣuṇīnām ṣaṣṭho gurudharmo yo bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvaṃ satkartavyo vistareṇa /🔽gurudharma
analyzed: ayam ānanda bhikṣuṇīnām ṣaṣṭhaḥ guru dharmaḥ yaḥ bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvam satkartavyaḥ vistareṇa 🔽guru dharma
translated: This, Ānanda, is the sixth important rule for the nuns, which the nuns should train in for life.

original: na kṣamati bhikṣuṇīhi abhikṣuke āvāse varṣām upagantuṃ /
analyzed: na kṣamati bhikṣuṇīhi abhikṣuke āvāse varṣām upagantum
translated: It is not allowable for nuns to enter the rains residence in a monastery without monks.

original: ayam ānanda bhikṣuṇīnāṃ saptamo gurudharmo yo bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvaṃ satkartavyo vistareṇa //
analyzed: ayam ānanda bhikṣuṇīnām saptamaḥ guru dharmaḥ yaḥ bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvam satkartavyaḥ vistareṇa
translated: This, Ānanda, is the seventh rule for nuns that is weighty, that should not be transgressed for one’s whole life, as is said in the detailed (account).
The weighty rules

original: varṣoṣitāhi ānanda bhikṣuṇīhi ubhayatosaṃghe pravāraṇā pratyāśaṃsitavyā /
analyzed: varṣa uṣitāhi ānanda bhikṣuṇīhi ubhayatas saṃghe pravāraṇā pratyāśaṃsitavyā
translated: Ānanda, nuns who have completed the rains residence should invite the two Sanghas.

original: ayam ānanda bhikṣuṇīnāṃ aṣṭamo gurudharmo yo bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvaṃ satkartavyo gurukartavyo mānayitavyo pūjayitavyo anatikramaṇīyo velā iva
analyzed: ayam ānanda bhikṣuṇīnām aṣṭamaḥ guru dharmaḥ yaḥ bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvam satkartavyaḥ gurukartavyaḥ mānayitavyaḥ pūjayitavyaḥ an atikramaṇīyaḥ velā iva
translated: This, Ānanda, is the eighth rule for nuns that is weighty, that should not be transgressed for one’s whole life, as is said in the detailed (account).
It is like the ocean.

analyzed: ime ānanda bhikṣuṇīnām aṣṭau guru dharma umā  yo ye
translated: These, Ānanda, are the eight rules for nuns that are weighty,

original: bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvaṃ satkartavyā gurukartavyā mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā anatikramaṇīyā velā iva samudreṇa //
analyzed: bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvam satkartavyā gurukartavyā mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā an atikramaṇīyā velā iva samudreṇa
translated: that should not be transgressed for one’s whole life, as is said in the detailed (account).

original: sace nāmānanda mahāprajāpatī gautamī imān aṣṭa gurudharmān pratīcchati catuhi ca patanīyehi dharmehi anadhyācārāya śikṣāṃ śikṣati /
analyzed: sace nāma ānanda mahāprajāpatī gautamī imān aṣṭa guru dharmān pratīcchati catuhi ca patanīyehi dharmehi anadhyācārāya śikṣām śikṣati
translated: If, Ānanda, Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī accepts these eight weighty rules,
this will be the going forth (for her).
This is the higher ordination, this is the state of a nun.

original: sādhu bhagavann iti āyuṣmān ānando bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā yena mahāprajāpatī gautamī tenopasaṃkramitvā mahāprajāpatīṃ gautamīṃ etad 🔽avocat /
analyzed: sādhu bhagavan iti āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā yena mahāprajāpatī gautamī tena upasaṃkramitvā mahāprajāpatīm gautamīm etat  avocat
translated: Well said, Blessed One, the Venerable Ānanda, having bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, approached Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī and said this to Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī:
Listen, Gautamī, to the Blessed One's words.

original: sayyathāpi nāma gautamī iha puruṣa parvatasaṃkṣepe setutuṃ
analyzed: sayyathā api nāma gautamī iha puruṣa parvata saṃkṣepe
translated: Just as, Gautamī, a man here, on a mountain slope, would build a dam

original: bandheya yāvad eva vāriṣya anatikramaṇāya evam eva gautamī bhagavān bhikṣuṇīnāṃ aṣṭagurudharmān prajñāpeti ye bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvaṃ satkartavyā
analyzed: bandheya yāvat eva an atikramaṇāya evam eva gautamī bhagavān bhikṣuṇīnām aṣṭa guru dharmān prajñāpeti ye bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvam satkartavyāḥ  /
translated: as far as the water goes, for the purpose of not crossing over, in the same way, Gautamī, the Blessed One has laid down eight weighty rules for nuns, which nuns should revere,

original: gurukartavyā mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā anatikramaṇīyā velāmiva samudreṇa /
analyzed: gurukartavyā mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā an atikramaṇīyā velām iva samudreṇa
translated: respect, honor, venerate, and not transgress as long as they live, like the ocean with its shoreline.

original: katame 'ṣṭa / varṣaśatopasampannāya gautamī bhikṣuṇīya tadahopasampannasya bhikṣusya pādā śirasā vanditavyā /

translated: What are the eight? Gautamī, a nun who has been ordained for a hundred years should bow her head at the feet of a monk who has been ordained that very day.

original: ayaṃ gautamī bhikṣuṇīnām prathamo gurudharmo yo bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvaṃ satkartavyo yo anatikramaṇīyo velāmiva samudreṇa /

translated: This is the first serious rule for the nuns, which should be honored all one’s life, which should not be transgressed, like the shoreline by the ocean.
All the eight serious rules are like this.
That very thing was announced to Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī.

original: yāva sace khu tvaṃ gautamī imān aṣṭa gurudharmān pratīcchasi catuhi ca patanīyehi dharmehi anadhyācārāya śikṣāṃ śikṣasi /
analyzed: tvam gautamī imān aṣṭa guru dharmān pratīcchasi catuhi ca patanīyehi dharmehi anadhyācārāya śikṣām śikṣasi
translated: If you accept these eight serious rules, and train in the training rules without transgression for four years,

original: eṣā eva te adyadagreṇa pravrajyā eṣā upasampadā eṣa bhikṣuṇībhāvo //
analyzed: eṣā eva te adya agreṇa pravrajyā eṣā upasampadā eṣa bhikṣuṇī bhāvaḥ
translated: then from today onwards your going forth will be your full acceptance, and you will be a nun.”

original: evam ukte mahāprajāpatī gautamī āyuṣmantam ānandam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte mahāprajāpatī gautamī āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī said this to Venerable Ānanda:🔽“Just as if, Ānanda, there were a young man, of handsome appearance, of good family, who had bathed his head and put on a new, clean turban,

original: sayyathāpi nāmānanda iha syāt yuvā puruṣo maṇḍanajātīyo śīrṣasnāto āhatavastranivastro utpalamālām vā campakamālām vā kumudamālām vā
analyzed: sayyathā api nāma ānandaḥ iha syāt yuvā puruṣaḥ maṇḍana jātīyaḥ śīrṣa snātaḥ āhata vastra nivastraḥ utpala mālām vā campaka mālām vā kumuda mālām vā
translated: and then a garland of blue lotuses, or a garland of jasmine, or a garland of campaka flowers,

original: tṛṇamolikamālām vā śirasā pratīccheya evam evāham āryānanda imān aṣṭagurudharmān śirasā pratīcchāmi catuhi ca patanīyehi dharmehi anadhyacārāya
analyzed: tṛṇamolikamālām vā śirasā pratīccheya evam eva aham ārya ānanda imān aṣṭa guru dharmān śirasā pratīcchāmi catuhi ca patanīyehi dharmehi anadhyacārāya
translated: I will accept this garland of grass and straw on my head, in the same way, Ānanda, I will accept these eight weighty rules on my head, not to transgress them even for the sake of four grave offenses.
I will train and train in each training rule.

original: atha khalu mahāprajāpatī gautamī sārdhaṃ cchandāyi cchandakapālāye dāsacchandāye cchandakamātare ca pañcahi ca śākiyāniśatehi sārdhaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu mahāprajāpatī gautamī sārdham chandāyi chandaka pālāye dāsacchandāye chandaka mātare ca pañcahi ca śākiyāni śatehi sārdham
translated: Then Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī, together with Chanda, Chanda-pālā, Dāsī-chanda, Chanda-mātrā, and five hundred Śākyan women,

original: yena bhagavān tenopasaṃkramitvā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte asthāsuḥ /
analyzed: yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkramitvā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte asthāsuḥ
translated: approached the Blessed One, bowed their heads at his feet, and stood to one side.

analyzed: ekānta sthitā āyaḥ bhikṣuṇīyaḥ bhagavān etat avocat
translated: While they were standing to one side, the Blessed One said this:

original: tasmād iha bhave bhikṣuṇīyo adydagreṇa mahāprajāpatīṃ gautamīṃ saṃghasthavirārāṃ
analyzed: tasmāt iha bhave bhikṣuṇīyaḥ adya agreṇa mahāprajāpatīm gautamīm saṃgha sthavira arām
translated: Therefore, from now on, the nuns should regard Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī as the senior nun,
as the great one in the order,
as the chief nun.

original: atha khalu mahāprajāpatī gautamī yena bhagavān tenāñjaliṃ praṇāmayitvā bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu mahāprajāpatī gautamī yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇāmayitvā bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then Mahāprajāpatī Gautamī, having bowed to the Blessed One with her head at his feet, said this to the Blessed One:

original: ye ime bhagavan bhikṣuṇīnāṃ aṣṭagurudharmā bhagavatā saṃkṣiptena bhāṣitā vistareṇa vibhaktā labhyā te 'smābhir vistareṇa śrotuṃ //
analyzed: ye ime bhagavan bhikṣuṇīnām aṣṭa guru dharmāḥ bhagavatā saṃkṣiptena bhāṣitāḥ vistareṇa vibhaktāḥ labhyā te smābhiḥ vistareṇa śrotum
translated: These eight weighty rules for nuns, Blessed One, which the Blessed One has spoken in brief, it is proper for us to hear them in detail, explained at length.
The Blessed One said:
It is proper.

original: āha /🔽kinti dānī gautamī varṣaśatopasampannāye bhikṣuṇīye tadahopasampannasya bhikṣusya abhivādanavandanapratyutthānāñjalīkarma samīcīkarma
analyzed: āha  kinti dānī gautamī varṣa śata upasampannāye bhikṣuṇīye tad aha upasampannasya bhikṣusya abhivādana vandana pratyutthāna añjalīkarma samīcīkarma
translated: She said:

How is it, Gautami, that a nun who has been fully ordained for a hundred years should perform the duties of saluting, worshipping, rising up, and joining the palms in reverence to a monk who has been fully ordained on that very day?
It is not proper for a nun to say:

original: yadāhaṃ varsaśatopasampannā bhaviṣyaṃ bhikṣu ca tad ahopasampanno bhaviṣyati tadāham abhivādanavandanapratyutthānamañjalīkarma sāmīcikarma
analyzed: yadā aham varsa śata upasampannā bhaviṣyam bhikṣu ca tat aha upasampannaḥ bhaviṣyati tadā aham abhivādana vandana pratyutthānam añjalīkarma sāmīcikarma
translated: 'When I will have been fully ordained for a hundred years, and the monk will have been fully ordained on that very day, then I will perform the duties of saluting, worshipping, rising up, joining the palms in reverence, and doing what is proper

original: kariṣyaṃ /🔽atha khalu sarvāhi bhikṣuṇīhi sthavirīhi vā navāhi vā madhyamāhi vā sarveṣāṃ bhikṣūṇām stherāṇāṃ navānāṃ mema
analyzed: kariṣyam  atha khalu sarvāhi bhikṣuṇīhi sthavirīhi vā navāhi vā madhyamāhi vā sarveṣām bhikṣūṇām stherāṇām navānām
translated: to him.'🔽 But rather, all nuns, whether senior, junior, or middle, should perform the duties of saluting, worshipping, rising up, joining the palms in reverence, and doing what is proper

analyzed: dhyamānām abhivādana vandana pratyutthāna añjalīkarma sāmīcikarma kartavyam
translated: to all monks, whether senior, junior, or middle.

original: ete dāni bhikṣū bhikṣūṇīupāśrayaṃ praviṣṭā bhavanti /🔽sarvāhi bhikṣuṇīhi stherīhi vā navāhi vā madhyamāhi vā sarveṣāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ stherāṇāṃ navānāñ ca madhyamānām abhivādanavandanapratyutthānāñjalīkarma
analyzed: ete dāni bhikṣū bhikṣūṇī upāśrayam praviṣṭāḥ bhavanti  sarvāhi bhikṣuṇīhi stherīhi vā navāhi vā madhyamāhi vā sarveṣām bhikṣūṇām stherāṇām navānām ca madhyamānām abhivādana vandana pratyutthāna añjalīkarma
translated: Now, if these monks enter the dwelling of the nuns,🔽all the nuns, whether senior, junior, or middle, must perform acts of respect such as bowing down, paying homage, rising up, and joining the palms in reverence
to all the monks, whether senior, junior, or middle.

original: atha dāni bhikṣuṇī jarādurbalā vā bhavati vyādhidurbalā vā yattakānāṃ abhisaṃbhuṇoti tattakānāṃ pādā śirasā vanditavyā /
analyzed: atha dāni bhikṣuṇī jarā durbalā vā bhavati vyādhi durbalā vā yattakānām abhisaṃbhuṇoti tattakānām śirasā vanditavyā
translated: But if a nun is weak from old age or weak from illness, she should bow her head to the feet of as many as she is able to.
To the rest, she should raise her joined palms above her head and say,
I pay homage at the feet of all the noble monks.

original: etāyo bhikṣuṇīyo bhikṣuvihāraṃ nirdhāvanti sarvāhi bhikṣuṇīhi stherīhi vā navāhi vā madhyamāhi vā sarveṣāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ therāṇāṃ navānāṃ madhyamānāṃ 🔽pādā śirasā vanditavyā /
analyzed: etāyaḥ bhikṣuṇīyaḥ bhikṣuvihāram nirdhāvanti sarvāhi bhikṣuṇīhi stherīhi vā navāhi vā madhyamāhi vā sarveṣām bhikṣūṇām therāṇām navānām madhyamānām  pādā śirasā vanditavyā
translated: If those nuns run out of the nunnery, all the nuns, whether senior, junior, or middle, must bow their heads to the feet of all the monks, whether senior, junior, or middle.

original: atha dāni bhikṣuṇī jarādurbalā bhavati vyādhidurbalā vā yattakānanām
analyzed: atha dāni bhikṣuṇī jarā durbalā bhavati vyādhi durbalā vā yatta kānanām
translated: But if a nun is weak from old age or weak from illness, she should bow her head to the feet of as many as she is able to.

original: abhisaṃ bhuṇoti tattakānāṃ pādā śirasā vanditavyā śiṣṭakānāṃ mūrdhni añjalīṃ kṛtvā vaktavyaṃ /
analyzed: abhisam bhuṇoti tattakānām śirasā vanditavyā śiṣṭakānām mūrdhni añjalīm kṛtvā vaktavyam
translated: She should bow her head to the feet of those who have been ordained for as many years as she has been, and to the heads of those who have been ordained longer, and say:
'I bow my head to the feet of all the Noble Sangha members.'

original: sā eṣā bhikṣuṇī avajñāya paribhavanena koṇṭabhikṣū ti vā kṛtvā ḍhossabhikṣū ti vā kṛtvā vaidyabhikṣū ti vā kṛtvā akhallamahalle ti
analyzed: sā eṣā bhikṣuṇī avajñāya paribhavanena koṇṭa bhikṣū ti vā kṛtvā ḍhossa bhikṣū ti vā kṛtvā vaidya bhikṣū ti vā kṛtvā a khalla mahalle ti
translated: If that nun, out of contempt and disrespect, calls the senior nuns 'half-baked nuns' or 'old donkeys' or 'doctor nuns' or 'unskilled and foolish,'

original: vā akuśalo ti vā apratikṛtijño ti vā kṛtvā na śirasā pādān vandati gurudharmam atikrāmati /
analyzed: vā akuśalaḥ ti vā a pratikṛti jñaḥ ti vā kṛtvā na śirasā pādān vandati guru dharmam atikrāmati
translated: and does not bow her head to their feet, she commits an offense entailing confession for transgressing the rule.

original: evaṃ gautamī varṣaśatopasampannāye bhikṣuṇīye tadahopasampannasya bhikṣusya śirasā vanditavyāvyaṃ /
analyzed: evam gautamī varṣa śata upasampannāye bhikṣuṇīye tad aha upasampannasya bhikṣusya śirasā
translated: Gautami, a nun who has been fully ordained for a hundred years should bow her head to the feet of a monk who has been fully ordained that very day.

original: ayaṃ gautamī bhikṣuṇīnāṃ prathamo gurudharmo yāvajjīvaṃ satkartavyo gurukartavyo mānayitavyo pūjayitavyo anatikramaṇīyo velāmiva samudreṇa
analyzed: ayam gautamī bhikṣuṇīnām prathamaḥ guru dharmaḥ yāvajjīvam satkartavyaḥ gurukartavyaḥ mānayitavyaḥ pūjayitavyaḥ an atikramaṇīyaḥ velām iva samudreṇa
translated: Gautami, this is the first rule that the nuns should train in for life, that they should honor, value, remember, and respect it, and not intentionally transgress it, just as the ocean does not transgress the shoreline.
gurudharma

original: kinti dāni gautamī aṣṭādaśavarṣāye kumārībhūtāye dvevarṣāṇi śikṣitaśikṣāye paripūrṇaśikṣāye ubhayatosaṃghe upasampadā pratyāsaṃsitavyā
analyzed: kinti dāni gautamī aṣṭādaśa varṣāye kumārī bhūtāye dve varṣāṇi śikṣita śikṣāye paripūrṇa śikṣāye ubhayatas saṃghe upasampadā pratyāsaṃsitavyā
translated: How then is Gautami, who is eighteen years old and a virgin, to be ordained by the Order of both Sanghas after two years of instruction and full training?

original: yā dāni eṣā aṣṭādaśavarṣā kumārībhūtā bhavati tāye bhikṣuṇīsaṃghe dvevarṣāṇī śikṣādeśanāsaṃmuti yācitavyā /
analyzed: yā dāni eṣā aṣṭādaśa varṣā kumārī bhūtā bhavati tāye bhikṣuṇī saṃghe dve varṣāṇī śikṣā deśanā saṃmuti yācitavyā
translated: Now, if she is eighteen years old and a virgin, she should ask the Order of nuns for the consent to the training for two years.
The one who performs the duties should perform the duties.
May the Noble Order listen to me.
This one, named so-and-so,

original: nāma aṣṭādaśavarṣā kumārībhūtā ākāṃkṣati tathāgatapravedite dharmavinaye pravrajyām upasampadāṃ bhikṣuṇībhāvaṃ /🔽yadi saṃghasya prāptakālaṃ iyamnāmā aṣṭādaśavarṣā kumārībhūtā saṃghaṃ dvevarṣāṇi śikṣādeśanāsaṃmutiṃ yāceyā /🔽yāciṣyati āryamiśrikāyo saṃgho iyam itthannāmā aṣṭādaśavarṣā kumārībhūtā dvevarṣāṇi śikṣādeśanāsaṃmutiṃ /
analyzed: nāma aṣṭādaśa varṣā kumārī bhūtā ākāṃkṣati tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye pravrajyām upasampadām bhikṣuṇī bhāvam  yadi saṃghasya prāpta kālam iyam nāmā aṣṭādaśa varṣā kumārī bhūtā saṃgham dve varṣāṇi śikṣā deśanā saṃmutim yāceyā  yāciṣyati saṃghaḥ iyam itthat nāmā aṣṭādaśa varṣā kumārī bhūtā dve varṣāṇi śikṣā deśanā saṃmutim
translated: who is eighteen years old and a virgin, desires to go forth in the Dharma and Vinaya proclaimed by the Tathāgata, to be ordained, to become a nun.🔽If it is the right time for the Order, the one named so-and-so, who is eighteen years old and a virgin, will ask the Order for the consent to the training for two years.🔽The Noble Order will listen to this one, named so-and-so, who is eighteen years old and a virgin, asking for the consent to the training for two years.

original: kṣamate taṃ saṃghasya yasmāt tūṣṇīm evam etaṃ dhārayāmi /
analyzed: kṣamate tam saṃghasya yasmāt tūṣṇīm evam etam dhārayāmi
translated: If the acceptance of this one, named so-and-so, who is eighteen years old and a virgin, asking for the consent to the training for two years is pleasing to the Noble Order, let the Noble Order accept it.🔽This is the motion.🔽This is the proclamation.
She should then request it, saying:
I pay homage to the Noble Sangha.

original: aham itthannāmā aṣṭādaśavarṣā kumārībhūtā ākāṃkṣāmi tathāgatapravedite dharmavinaye upasampadāṃ bhikṣuṇībhāvaṃ /
analyzed: aham itthannāmā aṣṭādaśa varṣā kumārī bhūtā ākāṃkṣāmi tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye upasampadām bhikṣuṇī bhāvam
translated: I, named so-and-so, who am eighteen years old and a maiden, desire full ordination in the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathagata, the state of a bhikshuni.

original: sosāhaṃ saṃghaṃ dve varṣāṇi śikṣādeśanāsaṃmutiṃ yācāmi /
analyzed: sosāham saṃgham dve varṣāṇi śikṣā deśanā saṃmutim yācāmi
translated: I request the Sangha for the consent to train for two years.

original: sādhu vata me āryasaṃgho dve varṣāṇi śikṣādeśanāsaṃmutiṃ detu /
analyzed: sādhu vata me ārya saṃghaḥ dve varṣāṇi śikṣā deśanā saṃmutim detu
translated: May the Noble Sangha please grant me the consent to train for two years.
Thus a second and a third time.
The presiding nun should perform the procedure, saying:

original: śṛṇotu me āryasaṃgho iyam itthannāmā aṣṭādaśavarṣā kumārībhūtā dve varṣāṇi śikṣādeśanāsaṃmutiṃ yācati /
analyzed: śṛṇotu me ārya saṃghaḥ iyam itthat nāmā aṣṭādaśa varṣā kumārī bhūtā dve varṣāṇi śikṣā deśanā saṃmutim yācati
translated: May the Noble Sangha listen to me. This named so-and-so, who is eighteen years old and a maiden, is requesting the consent to train for two years.

original: tasyā āryasaṃgho itthannāmāye aṣṭādaśavarṣāye kumārībhūtāye dve varṣāṇi śikṣādeśanāsaṃmutin dadyāt /
analyzed: tasyai ārya saṃghaḥ itthat nāmāye aṣṭādaśa varṣāye kumārī bhūta dve varṣāṇi śikṣā deśanā saṃmutin dadyāt
translated: The Noble Sangha is granting the consent to train for two years to named so-and-so, who is eighteen years old and a maiden.
This is the motion.
May the Noble Sangha listen to me.

original: iyam itthannāmā aṣṭādaśavarṣā kumārībhūtā ākāṃkṣati tathāgatapravedite dharmavinaye pravrajyām upasampadāṃ bhikṣuṇībhāvaṃ /
analyzed: iyam itthannāmā aṣṭādaśa varṣā kumārī bhūtā ākāṃkṣati tathāgata pravedite dharma vinaye pravrajyām upasampadām bhikṣuṇī bhāvam
translated: This one, named so-and-so, who is eighteen years old and a virgin, desires to go forth in the Dharma and Vinaya so well-proclaimed by the Realised One, to receive full ordination.

original: seyaṃ saṃghaṃ dve varṣāṇi śikṣādeśanāsaṃmutiṃ yācati /🔽tasyā saṃgho itthan nāmāye aṣṭādaśavarṣāye kumārībhūtāye dve varṣāṇi śikṣādeśanāsaṃmutin deti /
analyzed: sā iyam saṃgham dve varṣāṇi śikṣā deśanā saṃmutim yācati  tasyāḥ saṃghaḥ itthat nāma aṣṭādaśa varṣāye kumārī bhūta dve varṣāṇi śikṣā deśanā saṃmutin deti
translated: She is asking the Saṅgha for the consent to give the training for two years.🔽The Saṅgha is giving the consent to give the training for two years to the one named so-and-so, who is eighteen years old and a virgin.

original: yasyasyāāryamiśrikāṇāṃ kṣamati itthannāmāye aṣṭādaśavarṣāye kumārībhūtāye dve varṣāṇī śikṣādeśanāsaṃmutiṃ dīyamānāṃ saṃghena sosā🔽tūṣṇīm asya /
analyzed: kṣamati itthat nāmāye aṣṭādaśa varṣāye kumārī bhūta aye dve varṣāṇī śikṣā deśanā saṃmutim dīyamānām saṃghena  tūṣṇīm asya
translated: To whomsoever this is agreeable, he should remain silent.
To whomsoever it is not agreeable, he should speak.

original: evaṃ dvitīyaṃ pi tṛtīyaṃ pi dinnāmāryamiśrikāyo itthannāmāye aṣṭādaśavarṣāye kumārībhūtāye dve varṣāṇi śikṣādeśanāsaṃmutiḥ saṃghena
analyzed: evam dvitīyam tṛtīyam pi itthat nāma aṣṭādaśa varṣa kumārī bhūta aye dve varṣāṇi śikṣā deśanā saṃmutiḥ saṃghena
translated: In this way a second and a third time: the consent to give the training for two years to the one named so-and-so, who is eighteen years old and a virgin, has been given by the Saṅgha.

original: kṣamate taṃ saṃghasya yasmāt tūṣṇīm evam etaṃ dhārayāmi /
analyzed: kṣamate tam saṃghasya yasmāt tūṣṇīm evam etam dhārayāmi
translated: It is agreeable to the Saṅgha, therefore it is silent. Thus do I hold it.
What is her duty?

original: sarvabhikṣuṇīnān navikā sarvaśrāmaṇerīṇāṃ vṛddhā āsanaparyanto tāye sādisādayi tavyo /🔽bhaktaparyanto tāye sādayitavyo yvāguparyanto tāye sādayitavyo yat tasyā 'miṣam akalpikam taṃ bhikṣuṇīnāṃ āmiṣaṃ kalpikaṃ yaṃ
analyzed: sarva bhikṣuṇīnām sarva śrāmaṇerīṇām vṛddhāḥ  bhakta paryantaḥ tāye sādayitavyaḥ yvāgu paryantaḥ tāye sādayitavyaḥ yat tasyāḥ miṣam a kalpikam tam bhikṣuṇīnām āmiṣam kalpikam yam
translated: All the nuns are junior to her, all the novice nuns are senior to her. She should be given a seat and water according to her seniority.🔽Whatever food is not suitable for her is suitable for the nuns.

original: bhikṣuṇīnāṃ āmiṣaṃ kalpikaṃ tasyā taṃ āmiṣaṃ akalpikaṃ bhikṣuṇīyihi tasyāḥ tena parivartaśeyyā kartavyā tāya pi śrāmaṇerīṇāṃ tena parivartakaśeyyā
analyzed: bhikṣuṇīnām āmiṣam kalpikam tasyāḥ tam āmiṣam a kalpikam tasyāḥ tena parivarta śeyyā kartavyā  śrāmaṇerīṇām tena parivartaka śeyyā
translated: Whatever food is suitable for the nuns is not suitable for her. She should share her bed with the nuns.
