translated: This nun Dharmadinnā is asking the community here present, the receivers of the messenger's higher ordination for the higher ordained ones who are her pupils, who are named so-and-so and so-and-so, who are staying there,🔽for their higher ordination.

original: yadi saṃghasya prāptakālaṃ saṃgho itthannāmaṃ ca itthannāmaṃ ca dūtopasaṃpadāpratigrāhakān sammanyeyā /
analyzed: yadi saṃghasya prāpta kālam saṃghaḥ itthannāmam ca itthannāmam ca dūta upasaṃpadā pratigrāhakān sammanyeyā
translated: If it seems right to the Order, the Order may agree upon so-and-so and so-and-so as receivers of the undertaking of the messengers for the higher ordination.
This is the motion.

original: śṛṇotu me bhante saṃgho /🔽iyaṃ dharmadinnā bhikṣuṇī tasyā itthannāmā ca itthannāmā ca antevāsinī upasaṃpādyā tāsām ihāgacchantīnāṃ syād brahmacaryāntarāyo /
analyzed: śṛṇotu me bhante saṃghaḥ  iyam dharmadinnā bhikṣuṇī tasyāḥ itthannāmā ca itthannāmā ca antevāsinī upasaṃpādyā tāsām iha āgacchantīnām syāt brahmacarya antarāyaḥ
translated: Venerable sirs, let the Order listen to me.🔽This nun Dharmā has two pupils, so-and-so and so-and-so, who are to be ordained. It may be that there will be an obstacle to their chaste life if they come here.

original: seyaṃ dharmadinnā bhikṣuṇī itthannāmāye ca itthannāmāye ca antevāsinīnāṃ upasaṃpādyānāṃ tatrasthitānāṃ ihasthitaṃ saṃghaṃ dūtopasaṃpadāpratigrāhakān 🔽yācate /🔽tān saṃgho dharmadinnāye bhikṣuṇīye itthannāmaṃ ca itthannāmaṃ ca dūtopasaṃpadāpratigrāhakān sammanyati /
analyzed: sā iyam dharmadinnā bhikṣuṇī itthat nāma āye ca itthat nāma āye ca antevāsinīnām upasaṃpādyānām tatrasthitānām ihasthitam saṃgham dūta upasaṃpadā pratigrāhakān  yācate  tān saṃghaḥ dharmadinnāye bhikṣuṇīye itthat nāmam ca itthat nāmam ca dūta upasaṃpadā pratigrāhakān sammanyati
translated: This nun Dharmā is asking the Order for the undertaking of the messengers for the higher ordination of her pupils, so-and-so and so-and-so, who are staying there, from the Order staying here.🔽The Order is agreeing upon the nun Dharmā’s pupils, so-and-so and so-and-so, as receivers of the undertaking of the messengers for the higher ordination.

original: yeṣām āyuṣmantānāṃ kṣamati dharmadinnāye bhikṣuṇīye itthannāmo ca itthannāmo ca dūtopasaṃpadāpratigrāhakān sammanyiyamānān saṃghena /
analyzed: yeṣām āyuṣmantānām kṣamati dharmadinnāye bhikṣuṇīye itthannāmaḥ ca itthannāmaḥ ca dūta upasaṃpadā pratigrāhakān sammanyiyamānān saṃghena
translated: Those venerable ones who agree to the nun Dharmā’s pupils, so-and-so and so-and-so, being agreed upon as receivers of the undertaking of the messengers for the higher ordination by the Order,
they should remain silent.
Whoever does not agree, let him speak.
This is the first proclamation of the legal procedure.

original: evaṃ dvitīya tṛtīyā karmavācanā iti kartavyaṃ /
analyzed: evam dvitīya tṛtīyā karma vācanāḥ iti kartavyam
translated: In the same way, the second and third proclamation of the legal procedure should be done.
The venerable Saṅgha has consented.

original: dharmadinnāye bhikṣuniye itthannāmāye ca itthannāmāye ca antevāsinīnāṃ tāsām ihāgacchantīnāṃ syād brahmacaryāntarāya iti kṛtvā tatrasthitānām
analyzed: dharmadinnāye bhikṣuniye itthannāmāye ca itthannāmāye ca antevāsinīnām tāsām iha āgacchantīnām syāt brahmacarya antarāyaḥ iti kṛtvā tatrasthitānām
translated: Since it would be an obstacle to the celibate life for the nuns of the venerable Dharmadinnā, named so-and-so and so-and-so, who are coming here, and for those who are staying there,

original: ihasthitena saṃghena itthannāmo ca itthannāmo ca bhikṣū dūtopasaṃpadāpratigrāhakāḥ kṣamate taṃ saṃghasya yasmāt tūṣṇīm evam etad dhārayāmi
analyzed: ihasthitena saṃghena itthannāmaḥ ca itthannāmaḥ ca bhikṣū dūta upasaṃpadā pratigrāhakāḥ kṣamate tam saṃghasya yasmāt tūṣṇīm evam etat dhārayāmi
translated: the Saṅgha, staying here, has appointed the monks named so-and-so and so-and-so as the messengers to receive the full ordination. The Saṅgha approves of it, since it is silent. Thus it is upheld.

original: tehi dani sammatehi samānehi dharmadinnāye bhikṣuṇīye upāśrayaṃ gantavyaṃ /
analyzed: tehi dani sammatehi samānehi dharmadinnāye bhikṣuṇīye upāśrayam gantavyam
translated: Then, having been appointed and agreed upon, they should go to the dwelling place of the nun Dharmadinnā.

original: tāhi dāni dharmadinnāya antevāsinīhi te yācitavyāḥ /
analyzed: tāhi dāni dharmadinnāya antevāsinī hi te yācitavyāḥ
translated: Then the pupils of Dharmadinnā should request them, saying:

original: vandāmy āryaṃ ihasthitāyo itthannāmā ca itthannāmā ca āryāye dharmadinnāye upādhyāyinīye upasaṃpādyāyo /
analyzed: vandāmi āryam ihasthita ayo itthannāmā ca itthannāmā ca āryāye dharmadinnāye upādhyāyinīye
translated: We pay homage to the noble ones, named so-and-so and so-and-so, who are staying here, and to the noble Dharmadinnā as our preceptor, in order to receive full ordination.
We are pure, Venerable Ones.

original: itthannāmāya ca itthannāmāya ca āryāya raho 'nuśāstāyo tāsām asmākaṃ tatragacchantīnāṃ syād brahmacaryāntarāyo /
analyzed: itthat nāmāya ca itthat nāmāya ca āryāya tāsām asmākam tatra gacchantīnām syāt
translated: For the sake of so-and-so and so-and-so, noble ones, who are to be instructed in private, there might be an obstacle to our celibate life if we were to go there.

original: tā vayaṃ itthannāmā ca itthannāmā ca āryāya dharmadinnāya upādhyāyinīya tatrasthitaṃ saṃgham upasaṃpadaṃ yācāmaḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ vayam itthannāmā ca itthannāmā ca āryāya dharmadinnāya upādhyāyinīya tatrasthitam saṃgham upasaṃpadam yācāmaḥ
translated: We, so-and-so and so-and-so, request the noble Sangha, with the preceptor Dharmadiṇṇā, to grant full ordination to those who are staying there.

original: upasaṃpādetu me ārya saṃgho /🔽ullumpatetu🔽me āryo saṃgho /
analyzed: upasaṃpādetu me ārya saṃghaḥ  ullumpata itu  me āryaḥ saṃghaḥ
translated: May the noble Sangha grant me full ordination.🔽May the noble Sangha lift me up.

original: anukampatu me āryo saṃgho anukampako anukampām upādāya /
analyzed: anukampatu me āryaḥ saṃghaḥ anukampakaḥ anukampām upādāya
translated: May the noble Sangha, out of compassion, show compassion to me, out of compassion.
In the same way, request a second and a third time.
Then one should go to the monks' dwelling place.

original: yaṃ kālaṃ ubhayato saṃgho upaviṣṭo bhavati tato dharmadinnāya yācitavyaṃ /
analyzed: yam kālam ubhayatas saṃghaḥ upaviṣṭaḥ bhavati tatas dharma dinnāya yācitavyam
translated: When the two Sanghas are seated, then request Dharmadiṇṇā.
I pay homage to the noble Sangha.
I am the nun Dharmadiṇṇā.

original: tasyā itthannāmā ca itthannāmā ca antevāsinīyo upasaṃpādyāyo /
translated: Her students, so-and-so and so-and-so, are to be fully ordained.
They are pure with regard to the nuns.
For them, if they were to come here,
there might be an obstacle to their celibate life.

original: so sāhan dharmadinnā bhikṣuṇī itthannāmāya ca itthannāmāya ca antevāsinīnām upasaṃpādyānāṃ tatrasthitānām ihasthitaṃ saṃghaṃ upasaṃpadaṃ 🔽yācāmi /
analyzed: sā u sā ahan dharmadinnā bhikṣuṇī itthannāmāya ca itthannāmāya ca antevāsinīnām upasaṃpādyānām tatrasthitānām ihasthitam saṃgham upasaṃpadam  yācāmi
translated: She, the nun Dharmadinnā, has given full admission to the resident nuns named so-and-so and so-and-so, who are living there. She requests full admission from the Saṅgha here.

original: upasaṃpādetu tāyo saṃgho mayā itthannāmāya upādhyāyinīya /
translated: The Saṅgha should give full admission to those named so-and-so and so-and-so, who are living there, through the preceptor named so-and-so.

original: evaṃ dvitīyam pi tṛtīyaṃ pi yācitavyaṃ /
translated: In the same way, a second and a third time she should request.

analyzed: yam kālam dharma dinnāya yācitam bhavati
translated: When it is the proper time for Dharmadinnā to request,
then the messenger and the receivers of full admission should request.
I pay homage to the noble Saṅgha.

original: iyan dharmadinnā bhikṣuṇī tasyā itthannāmā ca itthannāmā ca antevāsinyo upasaṃpādyāyo /
analyzed: iyan dharmadinnā bhikṣuṇī tasyāḥ itthannāmā ca itthannāmā ca antevāsinyaḥ
translated: This nun Dharmadinnā has given full admission to her resident nuns named so-and-so and so-and-so.

analyzed: tāsām iha āgacchantīnām syāt brahmacarya antarāyaḥ
translated: For them, who are coming here, there might be an obstacle to the holy life.

original: tāhi itthannāmāya ca itthannāmāya ca dharmadinnāya upādhyāyinīya tatrasthitāhi ihasthitaḥ saṃgha upasaṃpadaṃ yācitaḥ /
analyzed: itthannāmāya ca itthannāmāya ca dharmadinnāya upādhyāyinīya ihasthitaḥ saṃghaḥ upasaṃpadam yācitaḥ
translated: Through the preceptor named so-and-so and so-and-so, Dharmadinnā, who are living there, they have requested full admission from the Saṅgha here.

original: upasaṃpādetu tāyo āryo saṃgho /🔽ullumpatu tāyo āryo saṃgho /
analyzed: upasaṃpādetu tāyaḥ āryaḥ saṃghaḥ  ullumpatu tāyo āryaḥ saṃghaḥ
translated: The noble Saṅgha should give full admission to them.🔽The noble Saṅgha should lift them up.
The noble Saṅgha should take pity on them.
out of compassion, having taken compassion into account.

original: evaṃ dvitīyam pi tṛtīyam pi yācitavyaṃ /
translated: In the same way, she should ask a second and a third time.
The one who performs the ceremony should perform the ceremony.

original: śṛṇotu me bhante saṃgho iyaṃ dharmadinnā bhikṣuṇī /
analyzed: śṛṇotu me bhante saṃghaḥ iyam dharmadinnā bhikṣuṇī
translated: Venerable Sir, may the Order listen to me. This nun Dharmadinnā,

original: tasyā itthannāmā ca itthannāmā ca antevāsinīyo upasaṃpādyāyo itthannāmā ca itthannāmā ca raho 'nuśāstāyo /🔽tāsām ihāgacchantīnāṃ syād brahmacaryāntarāyo tāhi itthannāmāya ca itthannāmāya ca dharmadinnāya upādhyāyinīya tatra sthitāhi ihasthitaḥ
analyzed: tasyāḥ itthannāmā ca itthannāmā ca antevāsinīyaḥ upasaṃpādyāyaḥ itthannāmā ca itthannāmā ca  tāsām iha āgacchantīnām syāt itthannāmāya ca itthannāmāya ca dharmadinnāya tatra
translated: whose pupils, who have been fully admitted, are so-and-so and so-and-so, and whose private inquirer pupils are so-and-so and so-and-so,🔽if they were to come here, there would be an obstacle to their chaste life. Therefore, the Order, which is here,
having asked the nun Dharmadinnā, whose pupils are so-and-so and so-and-so, and who is staying there,🔽for the full admission,
having given permission to those who have given permission,🔽having asked the nun Dharmadinnā, whose pupils are so-and-so and so-and-so,
whose bowl and robes are complete,

analyzed: deśita śikṣāyo paripūrṇa śikṣāyo sammatāyo viśuddhāyo bhikṣuṇīhi
translated: who have trained in the training, who have completed the training, who have been approved, who are pure, by the nuns,

analyzed: pariśuddha āyo antarāyikehi dharmehi ātmānam pratijānanti
translated: who declare themselves to be pure with regard to the obstacles,
and who are eager for the supports,

original: yadi saṃghasya prāptakālaṃ itthannāmāṃ ca itthannāmāṃ ca dharmadinnāya upādhyāyinīya tatrasthitāyo ihasthito saṃgho upāsaṃpādeyyā /
analyzed: yadi saṃghasya prāpta kālam itthannāmām ca itthannāmām ca dharmadinnāya upādhyāyinīya ihasthitaḥ saṃghaḥ
translated: If it is timely for the Saṅgha, the Saṅgha should give full ordination to so-and-so and so-and-so, who are resident there, through the Saṅgha resident here, with Dharmadiṇṇā as their preceptor.
This is the motion.
Venerable sirs, may the Saṅgha listen to me.
This is the nun Dharmadiṇṇā.

original: tasyā itthannāmā ca itthannāmā ca antevāsinīyo upasaṃpādyāyo /
translated: Her pupils so-and-so and so-and-so are to be given full ordination.

analyzed: itthat nāmāya ca itthat nāmāya ca rahaḥ
translated: They have been instructed in private by so-and-so and so-and-so.

analyzed: tāsām iha āgacchantīnām syāt brahmacarya antarāyaḥ
translated: If they were to come here, there might be an obstacle to their celibate life.

original: tāhi itthannāmāya ca itthannāmāya ca dharmadinnāya upādhyāyinīya tatrasthitāhi ihasthito saṃgho upasaṃpadaṃ yācito /🔽anujñātāyo anujñāpakehi /
analyzed: itthat nāmāya ca itthat nāmāya ca dharmadinnāya ihasthitaḥ saṃghaḥ upasaṃpadam yācitaḥ  anujñātāyaḥ anujñāpakehi
translated: Therefore, the Saṅgha resident here, through the Saṅgha resident there, with Dharmadiṇṇā as their preceptor, is requesting full ordination for them.🔽They have the permission of those who should give it.
They have requested their preceptor.
Their bowl and robes are complete.
They have been taught the teachings.
They have fulfilled the trainings.
They are approved and pure with regard to the nuns.

original: pariśuddhāyo antarāyikehi dharmehi ātmānaṃ pratijānāti nanti /
analyzed: pariśuddha āyo antarāyikehi dharmehi ātmānam pratijānāti nanti
translated: They declare themselves pure with regard to the obstacles.

original: tāyo saṃgho itthannāmāṃ ca itthannāmāṃ ca dharmadinnāya upādhyāyinīya ihasthito saṃgho upasaṃpādeti /
analyzed: saṃghaḥ itthannāmām ca itthannāmām ca dharmadinnāya upādhyāyinīyaḥ ihasthitaḥ saṃghaḥ
translated: The Saṅgha here, the Saṅgha present, is granting full ordination to so-and-so and so-and-so, with Dharmadiinnā as their preceptor.

original: yeṣām āyuṣmatāṃ kṣamati itthannāmā ca itthannāmā ca dharmadinnāya upādhyāyinīya tatrasthitāyo ihasthitena saṃghena upasaṃpādidīyamānāyo🔽so tūṣṇīm asya /
analyzed: yeṣām āyuṣmatām kṣamati itthannāmā ca itthannāmā ca dharmadinnāya tatrasthitāya ihasthitena saṃghena  sā u tūṣṇīm asya
translated: To those venerable ones it is pleasing,
he to whom it is not pleasing, let him speak.
This is the first proclamation.
In the same way, a second and a third proclamation.
The action is to be done.

original: upasampannā bhante saṃgho itthannāmā ca itthannāmā ca dharmadinnāya upādhyāyinīya tatrasthitāyo ihasthitena saṃghena /
analyzed: upasampannā bhante saṃghaḥ itthannāmā ca itthannāmā ca dharmadinnāya upādhyāyinīya ihasthitena saṃghena
translated: The Saṅgha here, the Saṅgha present, has granted full ordination to so-and-so and so-and-so, with Dharmadiinnā as their preceptor.

original: kṣamate taṃ saṃghasya yasmāt tūṣṇīm evam etan dhārayāmi /🔽evam upasaṃpadāya tehi dūtopasaṃpadāpratigrāhakehi bhikṣuṇyupāśrayaṅ gatvā tatā
analyzed: kṣamate tam saṃghasya yasmāt tūṣṇīm evam etat dhārayāmi  evam tehi dūta upasaṃpadā pratigrāhakehi bhikṣuṇī upāśrayam gatvā
translated: Since there is no objection from the Saṅgha, this will thus be upheld.

In this way, those who have been fully ordained by the Saṅgha through a messenger, having gone to the nuns' dwelling place, should say to those who have been fully ordained:🔽The Saṅgha has granted you full ordination.

original: etā itthannāmāyopasaṃpannāyo sūpasaṃpannāyo traivācikena karmaṇā jñapticaturthena /
analyzed: etāḥ itthannāmāya upasaṃpannāyaḥ su upasaṃpannāyaḥ traivācikena karmaṇā jñapti caturthena
translated: These, named so-and-so, are well-ordained by the three-statement procedure with a fourth announcement.

analyzed: anāghāta pañcamena  samagreṇa ubhayatas saṃghena daśa baddhena gaṇena
translated: By the fifth statement without striking.🔽By the complete Saṅgha on both sides, by the Saṅgha of ten.
Or by the Saṅgha of more than ten.
Do it in such a way that
you will be adorned with the Buddha,

analyzed: dharma śobhanā ca saṃgha śobhanā ca
translated: adorned with the Dharma, adorned with the Saṅgha.
The Buddha is the teacher,

original: dharma guru ca saṃgha guru ca /🔽upādhyāyinī guru ca /
analyzed: dharma guru ca saṃgha guru ca  upādhyāyinī guru ca
translated: the Dharma is the teacher, the Saṅgha is the teacher.🔽The preceptor is the teacher,
the instructor is the teacher.
Do it in such a way that
having attained, you will not fall away.
The assemblage of moments is difficult to obtain,

analyzed: yasya arthāya pravrajyā yasya arthāya upasaṃpadā
translated: for the sake of which there is going forth, for the sake of which there is higher ordination,

analyzed: tat śīlam anurakṣadhvam bāla agram camarī yathā
translated: preserve that morality like the tip of a hair of a horse.
What is pleasing and desired by the Buddha, the kinsman of the sun,

analyzed: śrāvikānām ca vijñānām nipuṇānām artha darśinām
translated: and by the wise disciples, the skilled ones who see the meaning,

original: so vo 'rtho anuprāpto labdhā vo upasaṃpadā //
analyzed: saḥ vaḥ rthaḥ anuprāptaḥ labdhā vaḥ upasaṃpadā
translated: that purpose of yours has been attained, you have obtained higher ordination.

original: aśokaṃ virajaṃ kṣemaṃ dvīpaṃ lenaṃ parāyaṇaṃ
analyzed: aśokam virajam kṣemam dvīpam lenam parāyaṇam
translated: The sorrowless, dustless, secure, island, shelter, refuge,

original: taṃ prāpuṇatha nirvāṇaṃ eṣā vo sarvasaṃpadā //
analyzed: tam prāpuṇatha nirvāṇam eṣā vaḥ sarva saṃpadā
translated: Attain that nirvana, this is your highest attainment.
The rest is to be connected as before.

original: evaṃ gautami aṣṭādaśavarṣāye kumārī bhūtāye ubhayataḥsaṃghe upasaṃpadā pratyāśaṃsitavyā /
analyzed: evam gautami aṣṭādaśa varṣāye kumārī bhūtāye ubhayatas saṃghe upasaṃpadā pratyāśaṃsitavyā
translated: Thus, Gautami, a girl who is eighteen years old should be ordained by the Order of both Sanghas.

original: ayaṃ gautami bhikṣuṇīnāṃ dvitīyo gurudharmo yo bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvaṃ satkartavyo yāvad velāmiva mahāsamudreṇa /
analyzed: ayam gautami bhikṣuṇīnām dvitīyaḥ guru dharmaḥ yaḥ bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvam satkartavyaḥ yāvat velām iva mahā samudreṇa
translated: This, Gautami, is the second important rule for the nuns, which the nuns should train in for life, just as the great ocean is for its water.
Important rule

original: kin ti dāni gautami āvaḍo bhikṣuṇīnāṃ bhikṣūhi vacanapatho bhūtena vā abhūtena vā anāvaḍo bhikṣūṇāṃ bhikṣuṇīhi vacanapatho bhūtena abhūtena
analyzed: kim ti dāni gautami āvaḍaḥ bhikṣuṇīnām bhikṣūhi vacana pathaḥ bhūtena vā abhūtena vā anāvaḍaḥ bhikṣūṇām bhikṣuṇīhi vacana pathaḥ bhūtena abhūtena
translated: What, Gautami, is the offense for nuns to speak to monks, whether it is true or not, and what is the offense for monks to speak to nuns, whether it is true or not?
It is not allowable for nuns to speak to monks
to strike

original: rṣiya vaktuṃ koṇṭabhikṣū ti vā vaidyabhikṣū ti vā cūḍabhikṣū ti vā akhallā mahallaapratijñaakuśalo ti vā vaktuṃ /
analyzed: vaktum koṇṭa bhikṣū ti vā vaidya bhikṣū ti vā cūḍa bhikṣū ti vā akhallā mahalla a pratijña akuśalaḥ ti vā vaktum
translated: to say, You are a monk who eats leftovers, or You are a monk who eats leftovers, or You are a monk who has a shaven head, or You are not skilled in the precepts, old man.

analyzed: athā eva jalpati guru dharmam atikramati
translated: If she speaks like this, she commits a serious offense.

If, however, a nun speaks harshly to a monk, saying, You are a monk who eats leftovers, or You are a monk who eats leftovers, or You are a monk who has a shaven head, or You are not skilled in the precepts, old man,

original: cit pravrajito bhavati jñātiko vā bhrātā vā /
analyzed: cit pravrajitaḥ bhavati jñātikaḥ vā bhrātā vā
translated: If he is a relative or a brother,

original: so ca bhavati uddhato unnaḍo /🔽na kṣamati adhyupekṣituṃ nāmapi kṣamati vadha
analyzed: saḥ ca bhavati uddhataḥ unnaḍaḥ  na kṣamati adhyupekṣitum kṣamati vadha
translated: and he is arrogant and conceited,
it is not allowable to ignore him. It is also not allowable to speak harshly to him.

original: atha khalu prajñayā samjñāpayitavyo yadi tāvat taruṇako bhoti vaktavyo /
analyzed: atha khalu prajñayā samjñāpayitavyaḥ yadi tāvat taruṇakaḥ vaktavyaḥ
translated: But rather he should be admonished with wisdom. If he is young, he should be told:

original: sālohita idānīṃ tvaṃ na śikṣasi kadā śikṣiṣyasi /
analyzed: sālohitaḥ idānīm tvam na śikṣasi kadā śikṣiṣyasi
translated: Venerable, now you are not training. When will you train?

original: kin dāni yadā jīrṇo vṛddho mahallako adhadhva
analyzed: kim dāni yadā jīrṇaḥ vṛddhaḥ mahallakaḥ
translated: What will you do when you are old, aged, advanced in years,
and have reached the last stage of life?

original: etat tava sādhu etat pratirūpaṃ yac ca uddiśeśi svādhyāyesi bhadrako guṇavān śikṣākāmo bhavesi buddhānām śāsane yogam āpadyesi /
analyzed: etat tava sādhu etat pratirūpam yat ca uddiśeśi svādhyāyesi bhadrakaḥ guṇavān śikṣā kāmaḥ bhavesi buddhānām śāsane yogam āpadyesi
translated: It is good for you, it is fitting for you, that you are reciting and studying. You will be virtuous, endowed with good qualities, desirous of training, and will apply yourself to the teaching of the Buddhas.
But if he is old,
he should be told:

original: idanīṃ imīdṛśo punas tvaṃ taruaṇakāle idānīṃ tvaṃ na śikṣasi kadā śikṣiṣyasi /
analyzed: punar tvam taruaṇa kāle idānīm tvam na śikṣasi kadā śikṣiṣyasi
translated: Now, you are like this. When you were young, now you were not training. When will you train?

original: kin dāni yadā maṇḍaladvāram anuprāpto bhaviṣyasi tadā śikṣiṣyasi yā py eṣā tava parṣā sāpi tava dṛṣṭā anukṛtim āpadyamānā anayavyasanam
analyzed: kim dāni yadā maṇḍala dvāram anuprāptaḥ bhaviṣyasi tadā śikṣiṣyasi yā pi eṣā tava parṣā sā api tava dṛṣṭā anukṛtim āpadyamānā anaya vyasanam
translated: But now, when you have reached the door of the monastery, you will learn. And your assembly, too, will see you, and will imitate you, and will fall into misfortune and disaster.

original: āpadyiṣyatīti etat tava sādhu etat pratirūpaṃ yat tvam uddiśasi svādhyāyesi bhadrako guṇavān /
analyzed: āpadyiṣyati iti etat tava sādhu etat pratirūpam yat tvam uddiśasi svādhyāyesi bhadrakaḥ guṇavān
translated: It would be good for you, it would be proper for you, if you would recite and study. You are fortunate, you have good qualities.

original: śikṣākāmo bhavesi buddhānāṃ śāsane yogam āpadyesi sā eṣā bhikṣuṇī anuava
analyzed: śikṣā kāmaḥ bhavesi buddhānām śāsane yogam āpadyesi sā eṣā bhikṣuṇī
translated: You should be desirous of training in the teaching of the Buddhas, and you should apply yourself. But this nun, out of contempt or out of contempt,

original: jñāya vā paribhavena vā koṇṭabhikṣū ti vā vaidyabhikṣū ti vā cūḍabhikṣū ti vā akhallamahallaaprakṛtijñaakuśalo ti vā dharṣiya jalpati
analyzed: jñāya vā paribhavena vā koṇṭa bhikṣu ti vā vaidya bhikṣu ti vā cūḍa bhikṣu ti vā a khalla mahalla a prakṛti jña a kuśalaḥ ti vā jalpati  /
translated: says, 'You are a monk who eats leftovers,' or 'You are a monk who eats what is given,' or 'You are a monk who wears rags,' or 'You are not skilled in what is proper and improper, in what is allowable and what is not.'
She transgresses a grave offense.

original: anāvaḍo bhikṣūṇāṃ bhikṣuṇīhi vacanapatho bhūtena vā abhūtena iti na kṣamati bhikṣuṇā bhikṣuṇīṃ dharṣiya vaktuṃ muṇḍastrī chinnakavaḍeti
analyzed: an āvaḍaḥ bhikṣūṇām bhikṣuṇīhi vacana pathaḥ bhūtena vā abhūtena iti na kṣamati bhikṣuṇā bhikṣuṇīm vaktum muṇḍa strī chinna kavaḍā iti
translated: It is not allowable for a monk to say to a nun, 'You are a shaven-headed woman, a cut-purse,' out of contempt or out of contempt.
If he speaks, he commits a transgression of the rules of training.
Now, if a monk

original: mātā vā bhaginī vā pravrajitikā bhavati sā ca uddhatā vā unnaḍā vā bhavati /
analyzed: mātā vā bhaginī vā pravrajitikā bhavati sā ca uddhatā vā unnaḍā vā bhavati
translated: If a mother or a sister has gone forth, and she is haughty or conceited,

original: na kṣamati adhyupekṣituṃ yadi tāvat taruṇikā bhoti /
analyzed: na kṣamati adhyupekṣitum yadi tāvat taruṇikā
translated: it is not allowable to ignore her. If she is young,
she should be told:

original: sālohite idānīṃ tvaṃ na śikṣiṣyasi kadā śikṣiṣyasi /
analyzed: sālohite idānīm tvam na śikṣiṣyasi kadā śikṣiṣyasi
translated: “Now, Noble Lady, you are not training. When will you train?

original: kiṃ dāni yaṃ kālaṃ jīrṇavṛddhā mahallikā bhaviṣyasi etat tava sādhu etat pratirūpaṃ yat tvaṃ uddiśesi svādhyāyesi bhadrikā guṇavatī śikṣākāmā
analyzed: kim dāni yam kālam jīrṇa vṛddhā mahallikā bhaviṣyasi etat tava sādhu etat pratirūpam yat tvam uddiśesi svādhyāyesi bhadrikā guṇavatī śikṣā kāmā  /
translated: What is good for you now is that you are reciting and reciting by heart. It is fitting and proper that you should be desirous of training.
You should be good and endowed with virtues, and you should apply yourself to the training of the Buddhas.
But if she is old,
she should be told:

original: sālohite idānīṃ tvam īdṛśī kīdṛśī punas taruṇīkāle idānīṃ tvan na śikṣasi kadā śikṣiṣyasi kin dāni yaṃ kālaṃ maṇḍaladvāram anuprāptā bhavisyasi
analyzed: sālohite idānīm tvam īdṛśī kīdṛśī punar taruṇī kāle idānīm tvat na śikṣasi kadā śikṣiṣyasi kim dāni yam kālam maṇḍala dvāram anuprāptā bhavisyasi  /
translated: “Now, Noble Lady, you are like this. What were you like when you were young? Now you are not training. When will you train? What is good for you now is that when you reach the threshold of the cemetery,

original: tadā śikṣiṣyasi yā py eṣā tava parṣā sāpi tava dṛṣṭā anukṛtim āpadyamānā anayena vyasanam āpadyiṣyatīti /
analyzed: tadā śikṣiṣyasi yā pi eṣā tava parṣā sā api tava dṛṣṭā anukṛtim āpadyamānā anayena vyasanam āpadyiṣyati iti
translated: then you will train. And your assembly will also see you, and will fall into misfortune through your bad example.”

original: etat tava sādhu etat pratirūpaṃ yat tvaṃ uddiśesi svādhyāyasi bhadrikā guṇavatī śikṣākāmā bhavesi buddhānāṃ śāsane yogam āpadyesīti /🔽eṣa gautami āvaṭo bhikṣuṇīnāṃ bhikṣūhi vacanapatho bhūtena vā /🔽abhūtena vā /
analyzed: etat tava sādhu etat pratirūpam yat tvam uddiśesi su ādhyāyasi bhadrikā guṇavatī śikṣā kāmā bhavesi buddhānām śāsane yogam āpadyesi iti  eṣa gautami āvaṭaḥ bhikṣuṇīnām bhikṣūhi vacana pathaḥ bhūtena vā  a bhūtena vā
translated: This is good for you, this is fitting, that you should recite and study. It is good that you should be desirous of training, and apply yourself to the Buddha’s teaching.”

original: anāvaṭo bhikṣūṇāṃ bhikṣuṇīhi vacanapatho bhūtena no abhūtena /🔽ayaṃ gautami bhikṣuṇīnām tṛtiyo gurudharmo yo bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvaṃ śasa🔽tkartavyo yāvad anatikramaṇīyo velāmiva mahāsamudreṇa /🔽gurudharma🔽kin ti dāni gautami bhaktāgraṃ śayanāsanāgraṃ vihārāgrañ ca bhikṣuṇīhi bhikṣusaṃghātośāsā
analyzed: an āvaṭaḥ bhikṣūṇām bhikṣuṇīhi vacana pathaḥ bhūtena no a bhūtena  ayam gautami bhikṣuṇīnām tṛtiyaḥ guru dharmaḥ yaḥ bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvam  tkartavyaḥ yāvat an atikramaṇīyaḥ velām iva mahā samudreṇa  guru dharma  kim ti dāni gautami bhakta agram śayana āsana agram vihāra agram ca bhikṣuṇīhi bhikṣu saṃghāta uśāsā
translated: This, Gautami, is the rule for nuns in regard to the rule for monks, whether it is a rule based on the offence of wrong-doing or a rule based on the offence that requires a Formal Meeting of the Order.🔽Whether it is a rule based on the offence of wrong-doing or a rule based on the offence that requires a Formal Meeting of the Order.

original: dayitavyaṃ /🔽eṣo dāni koci bhikṣuṇīsaṃghasya bhaktaṃ karoti vaktavyo /🔽jyeṣṭhaparyāyatā karohīti /🔽atha dāni so āha nāsti mama taṃhi śraddhā nāsti prasādo ti vaktavyaḥ /🔽vayaṃ pi na praticchāmo ti /
analyzed: dayitavyam 🔽eṣaḥ dāni koci bhikṣuṇī saṃghasya bhaktam karoti vaktavyaḥ 🔽jyeṣṭha paryāya tā karohi iti 🔽atha dāni saḥ āha na asti mama śraddhā na asti prasādaḥ ti vaktavyaḥ 🔽vayam pi na ti
translated: This, Gautami, is the third important rule for nuns, which was laid down by the Lord, a rule entailing grave offence, which should not be transgressed for life, should not be despised after the passing of the Lord, a rule which should be observed by the Order of nuns in fear.
Now the nuns said:

original: dattapūrvaṃ teṣāṃ mama mātrā vā pitrā vā goṣṭhīsambandhena vā śreṇīsaṃbandhena vā samayasambhandhena vā āryamiśrikāṇāṃ na kadācin mayā
analyzed: datta pūrvam teṣām mama mātrā vā pitrā vā goṣṭhī sambandhena vā śreṇī saṃbandhena vā samaya sambhandhena vā ārya miśrikāṇām na kadācid mayā
translated: “It has never been given to us by your mother or father or by a connection of the family or by a connection of the guild or by a connection of the village, but it has been given to the community of monks by the noble Āryamitra.
We have never before given a meal.

original: pratigṛhṇantu āryamiśrikā ti antamasato ekapiṇḍapātaṃ pi dāpayitvā bhikṣusaṃghasya bhikṣuṇīsaṃgho śatarasaṃ pi bhojanaṃ praticchati anāpattiḥ
analyzed: pratigṛhṇantu āryamiśrikā ti antamasataḥ eka piṇḍapātam pi dāpayitvā bhikṣu saṃghasya bhikṣuṇī saṃghaḥ śata rasam pi bhojanam praticchati anāpattiḥ
translated: Let the noble Āryamitra accept it, and if she gives even a single meal to the community of monks, the community of nuns will accept a hundred-flavored meal. There is no offense.”

analyzed: kim ti dāni śayana āsana agram
translated: Now what is the best of resting places?

original: eṣo dāni kocid bhikṣuṇīsaṃghasya śayanāsanaṃ dadāti /
analyzed: eṣaḥ dāni kocid bhikṣuṇī saṃghasya śayanāsanam dadāti
translated: If someone gives a resting place to the community of nuns,
saying, “Give it to the most senior.”

original: atha dāni so āha nāsti mama tahiṃ śraddhā nāsti prasādo / vaktavyaṃ / vaktavyaṃ /
analyzed: atha dāni saḥ āha na asti mama tahim śraddhā na asti prasādaḥ vaktavyam vaktavyam
translated: If he says, “I have no faith or confidence in that,” he should be told, “You should speak.”
“We also do not accept it.”
If he says,

original: dattapūrvaṃ mama ārye bhikṣusaṃghasya śayanāsanaṃ mātrā vā yāvat samayasambandhena vā /🔽pratīcchantvāryamiśrikā ti antamasato khayu /
analyzed: datta pūrvam mama ārye bhikṣu saṃghasya śayanāsanam mātrā vā yāvat samaya sambandhena vā 🔽pratīcchantu ārya miśrikā
translated: “Noble one, it has been given to the community of monks by your mother or by a connection of the family or by a connection of the guild or by a connection of the village,🔽let the noble Āryamitra accept it, and if she gives even a single meal to the community of monks, the community of nuns will accept a hundred-flavored meal.”

original: kā maṃcaṃ pi bhikṣusaṃghasya dāpayitvā mahārhaṃ śayanāsanaṃ bhikṣuṇīsaṃghaḥ pratīcchaty anāpattiḥ /
analyzed: kā bhikṣu saṃghasya dāpayitvā mahārham śayanāsanam bhikṣuṇī saṃghaḥ pratīcchati anāpattiḥ
translated: If a nun, having had a bed or seat of great value made for the community of monks, accepts it from the community of nuns, there is no offense.
What is meant by the best monastery?

original: eṣo dāni kocit bhikṣuṇīsaṃghasya vihāraṃ pratiṣṭhāpayati /
analyzed: eṣaḥ dāni kocid bhikṣuṇī saṃghasya vihāram pratiṣṭhāpayati
translated: If someone establishes a monastery for the community of nuns,
it should be said:

analyzed: jyeṣṭhaparyāya tā vat pratiṣṭhāpaya ihi iti
translated: Establish it according to the order of seniority.

original: atha dān āha /🔽ārye nāsti mama tahiṃ śraddhā /
analyzed: atha dān āha  ārye na asti mama tahim śraddhā
translated: If she then says:🔽Noble one, I have no faith in that.
I have no confidence.

original: vaktavyaṃ vayaṃ pi na pratīcchāmo ti /
analyzed: vaktavyam vayam pi na pratīcchāmaḥ ti
translated: It should be said: We also do not accept it.
If she then says:

original: ārye kārāpitan teṣāṃ vihārāḥ mātrā vā yāvat samayasambandhena vā pratīcchantv āryamiśrikā vihahā
analyzed: ārye teṣām vihārāḥ mātrā vā yāvat samaya sambandhena vā pratīcchantu ārya miśrikāḥ
translated: Noble ones, they have had monasteries built, either by their mothers or up to by means of a connection, may the noble nuns accept the monasteries.

original: ran ti antamasato gomayagṛhaṃ pi piṣṭhagṛhaṃ pi bhikṣusaṃghasya dāpayitvā bhikṣuṇīsaṃgho saptabhūmakaṃ pi vihāraṃ pratīcchaty anāpattiḥ
analyzed: ti antamasataḥ gomaya gṛham pi piṣṭha gṛham pi bhikṣu saṃghasya dāpayitvā bhikṣuṇī saṃghaḥ sapta bhūmakam pi vihāram pratīcchati anāpattiḥ
translated: Even if, having had a cow-dung hut or a flour-grinding hut made for the community of monks, the community of nuns accepts a seven-storied monastery, there is no offense.

original: tā etā bhikṣuṇīyo avajñāya paribhavena vā koṇṭabhikṣū ti vā /
analyzed: tāḥ etāḥ bhikṣuṇīyaḥ avajñāya paribhavena vā koṇṭa bhikṣū ti vā
translated: Those nuns, out of contempt and disrespect, call them defective monks
or physician monks.

original: akhallamahallāprakṛtijño tī vā kṛtvā bhaktāgraṃ śayanāsanāgraṃ vihārāgraṃ bhikṣusaṃghāto na śātiyati gurudharmam atikrāmati /
analyzed: vā kṛtvā bhakta agram śayana āsana agram vihāra agram bhikṣu saṃghātaḥ na śātiyati guru dharmam atikrāmati
translated: If she does not know the nature of the people who are not skilled in the rules, and if she does not give the first portion of the food, the first portion of the bed and seat, and the first portion of the dwelling, she is disobedient to the community of monks and she transgresses the rule of the teacher.

original: evaṃ gautamī bhaktāgraṃ śayanāsanagraṃ vihārāgraṃ bhikṣuṇīhi bhikṣusaṃghāto sātayitavyo /
analyzed: evam gautamī bhakta agram śayana āsana agram vihāra agram bhikṣuṇīhi bhikṣu saṃghātaḥ sātayitavyaḥ
translated: In the same way, Gautami, the first portion of the food, the first portion of the bed and seat, and the first portion of the dwelling should be given to the community of monks by the nuns.

original: ayaṃ gautami bhikṣuṇīnāṃ caturtho gurudharmo yo bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvaṃ satkartavyo yāvad anatikramaṇīyo velāmiva mahāsamudreṇa /
analyzed: ayam gautami bhikṣuṇīnām caturthaḥ guru dharmaḥ yaḥ bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvam satkartavyaḥ yāvat an atikramaṇīyaḥ velām iva mahā samudreṇa
translated: This, Gautami, is the fourth rule for a nun which she must not transgress as long as she lives, which she must practice as long as she lives, which she must not be disobedient to, just as the great ocean does not transgress the shoreline.
The rule of the teacher

original: kin ti dāni gurudharmāpanāyamnnāya🔽bhikṣuṇīya ardhamāsaṃ mānatvañ caritavyaṃ ubhayataḥ saṃghe āhvayanaṃ /
analyzed: kim ti dāni  bhikṣuṇīya ardha māsam māna tvam caritavyam ubhayatas saṃghe āhvayanam
translated: What is the observance of the rule of the teacher?🔽A nun must observe the state of being a probationer for two years in both communities, and must be invited by both communities.

original: sā dāni eṣā bhikṣuṇī gurudharmān apannā bhavati tāya ardhamāsaṃ bhikṣuṇīsaṃghe mānatvaṃ caritavyaṃ ubhayataḥ saṃghe ca āhvayanaṃ /
analyzed: sā dāni eṣā bhikṣuṇī guru dharmān apannā bhavati tāya ardha māsam bhikṣuṇī saṃghe māna tvam caritavyam ubhayatas saṃghe ca āhvayanam
translated: If that nun has transgressed the rule of the teacher, she must observe the state of being a probationer for two years in the community of nuns and must be invited by both communities.

original: sā eṣā bhikṣuṇī avajñāya vā paribhavena vā yāvad akuśalo ti vā kṛtvā gurudharmāpannā samānā nārdhamāsaṃ bhikṣuṇīsaṃghe mānatvaṃ carati ubhayataḥ
analyzed: sā eṣā bhikṣuṇī avajñāya vā paribhavena vā yāvat vā kṛtvā guru dharma āpannā samānā na ardha māsam bhikṣuṇī saṃghe māna tvam carati ubhayatas
translated: That nun, out of contempt or disrespect, or because she thinks it is not beneficial, having fallen into a grave offense, does not go for probation for half a month in the community of nuns, and does not request both
communities for the lifting of the suspension.
She transgresses a grave offense.

original: ayaṃ gautami bhikṣuṇīnāṃ pañcamo gurudharmo yo bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvaṃ satkartavyo yāvad velāmiva mahāsamudreṇa /
analyzed: ayam gautami bhikṣuṇīnām pañcamaḥ guru dharmaḥ yaḥ bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvam satkartavyaḥ yāvat velām iva mahā samudreṇa
translated: Gautami, this is the fifth grave offense of nuns, which nuns should not commit during their whole life, just as the great ocean is not filled by the rivers.
Grave offense

original: kin ti dāni anvārdhamāsaṃ bhikṣuṇīhi bhikṣusaṃghāto ovādopasaṃkramaṇaṃ pratyāśaṃsitavyaṃ yadaho dāni poṣadho bhavati tadaho bhikṣuṇīsaṃghena
analyzed: kim ti dāni anvārdha māsam bhikṣuṇīhi bhikṣu saṃghātaḥ ovāda upasaṃkramaṇam pratyāśaṃsitavyam yat aho dāni poṣadhaḥ bhavati tat aho bhikṣuṇī saṃghena
translated: What is the half-monthly request for instruction by nuns to the community of monks? On the day of the observance, the community of nuns
should go to the monastery of the monks.

original: atha dāni sarvasaṃgho na gacchati ardhasaṃghena gantavyaṃ /
analyzed: atha dāni sarva saṃghaḥ na gacchati ardha saṃghena gantavyam
translated: If the whole community does not go, half the community should go.

original: ardhasaṃgho na gacchati aṣṭāhi vṛddhatarikāhi gantavyaṃ /
translated: If half the community does not go, eight or more senior nuns should go.

original: aṣṭa vṛddhatarikā na gacchanti antamasato māsacārikiṇīhi pakṣacārikiṇīhi vā cchandārhaṇāṃ chandaṃ gṛhṇīya gantavyaṃ /
analyzed: aṣṭa vṛddhatarikāḥ na gacchanti antamasataḥ māsa cārikiṇīhi pakṣa cārikiṇīhi vā chanda arhaṇām chandam gṛhṇīya gantavyam
translated: The eight senior nuns should not go, even if they are invited by those who travel for a month or a fortnight. They should go after receiving consent.

original: yadi tāvad anukālyaṃ bhavati stūpo tāvad vanditavyo /
analyzed: yadi tāvat anukālyam bhavati stūpaḥ tāvat vanditavyaḥ
translated: If it is early, they should first pay homage to the stūpa.

original: stūpaṃ vanditvā yo tahiṃ bhikṣur abhilakṣito bhavati parijñāto vā tasya chando dātavyo /
analyzed: stūpam vanditvā yaḥ tahim bhikṣuḥ abhilakṣitaḥ bhavati parijñātaḥ vā tasya chandaḥ dātavyaḥ
translated: After paying homage to the stūpa, they should give consent to the nun who is known and recognized there.
They should say, We pay homage to the noble Saṅgha.

original: āryasamagro bhikṣuṇīsaṃgho samagrasya bhikṣusaṃghasya pādān śirasā vandati /
analyzed: ārya samagraḥ bhikṣuṇī saṃghaḥ samagrasya bhikṣu saṃghasya pādān śirasā vandati
translated: The noble Saṅgha of nuns, complete, pays homage with their heads at the feet of the complete Saṅgha of monks.
They request the Dharma of approaching for instruction.
They accept the Poṣadha.
This should be said a second and a third time.

original: atha dān āha /🔽ahaṃ saṃghasthaviro ahaṃ tatradeśako ahaṃ bhikṣuṇīovādako ti tābhir api ete trayo varjaṃ kṛtvā śiṣṭakānāṃ chando dātavyo chandaṃ datvā bhikṣuṇīupāśrayaṃ
analyzed: atha dān āha  aham saṃgha sthaviraḥ aham tatradeśakaḥ aham ti tābhiḥ api ete trayaḥ varjam kṛtvā śiṣṭakānām chandaḥ chandam da tvā bhikṣuṇī upāśrayam
translated: Then, if they say,

I am the senior monk there, I am the instructor, I am the instructor of nuns, then after excluding those three, consent should be given to the remaining ones. After giving consent, they should go to the nuns' dwelling place.

original: yaṃ kālaṃ bhikṣuṇīsaṃgho upaviṣṭo bhavati poṣasdhakarmāya sūtroddeśi kāya sūtraṃ pragṛhītaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yam kālam bhikṣuṇī saṃghaḥ upaviṣṭaḥ bhavati poṣasdha karmāya sūtra uddeśi kāya sūtram pragṛhītam bhavati
translated: When the community of nuns has assembled for the Poṣadha ceremony, and the Sūtra reciter has taken up the Sūtra,

original: śṛṇotu me āryasaṃgho adya saṃghasya cāturdaśiko vā pāñcadaśiko vā sandhipoṣadho vā viśuddhinakṣatraṃ ettakaṃ ṛtusya nirgataṃ ettakam avaśiṣṭaṃ
analyzed: śṛṇotu me ārya saṃghaḥ adya saṃghasya cāturdaśikaḥ vā pāñcadaśikaḥ vā sandhi poṣadhaḥ vā viśuddhi nakṣatram ettakam ṛtusya nirgatam ettakam avaśiṣṭam
translated: Let the noble community listen to me! Today is the fourteenth, fifteenth, or the Poṣadha of the half-month for the community, the lunar mansion is pure, so much of the rainy season has passed, so much remains,
What is the community's prior duty?

original: alpārtho 'lpakṛtyo bhagavataḥ śrāvikāsaṃgho śobhati anāgatānām āryamiśrikāṇāṃ chandapariśuddhiṃ ārocetha /
analyzed: alpa arthaḥ lpa kṛtyaḥ bhagavataḥ śrāvikā saṃghaḥ śobhati anāgatānām āryamiśrikāṇām chanda pariśuddhim ārocetha
translated: The Blessed One's community of nuns shines in having few concerns and few duties. Announce the purity of intention to the noble nuns who have not yet come.

original: nīto chandahārikāhi chando ti tāhi vṛddhāntam āruhitvā sāmīciṃ kṛtvā vaktavyaṃ /
analyzed: chanda ti tāhi vṛddha antam āruhitvā sāmīcim kṛtvā vaktavyam
translated: The intention has been brought by the bearers of the intention. Having ascended to the end of the elders, having done what is proper, it should be said,

original: nīto 'smābhiḥ chandahārikābhiś chando itthan nāmenāryeṇa pratīcchito /
analyzed: nītaḥ smābhiḥ chanda hārikābhiḥ chandaḥ itthat nāmena āryeṇa pratīcchitaḥ
translated: The intention has been brought by us, the bearers of the intention, it has been accepted by the noble one named so-and-so.

original: yaṃ kālaṃ bhikṣusaṃgho upaviṣṭo bhavati sūtroddeśakena sūtraṃ pratigṛhītaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yam kālam bhikṣu saṃghaḥ upaviṣṭaḥ bhavati sūtra uddeśakena sūtram pratigṛhītam bhavati
translated: When the community of monks has assembled, and the Sūtra reciter has taken up the Sūtra,

original: śṛṇotu me bhante saṃgho adya saṃghasya cāturdaśiko vā pāñcadaśiko vā sandhipoṣadho vā viśuddhinakṣatraṃ /
analyzed: śṛṇotu me bhante saṃghaḥ adya saṃghasya cāturdaśikaḥ vā pāñcadaśikaḥ vā sandhi poṣadhaḥ vā viśuddhi nakṣatram
translated: May the venerable Saṅgha listen to me. Today is the fourteenth, or fifteenth, or the day before the poṣadha of the Saṅgha. The lunar mansion of the purification (of the moon) has arrived.
So much of the rainy season has passed, so much remains.

original: kiṃ saṃghasya pūrvakṛtvā alpārtho alpakṛtyo bhagavataḥ śrāvakasaṃgho śobhati /
analyzed: kim saṃghasya pūrva kṛtvā alpa arthaḥ alpa kṛtyaḥ bhagavataḥ śrāvaka saṃghaḥ śobhati
translated: What should the Saṅgha do first? The Saṅgha of the Blessed One's disciples shines when it has little business and little activity.

analyzed: anāgatānām āyuṣmantaḥ bhikṣūṇām chanda pāriśuddhim ārocetha
translated: Venerable ones, announce the purity of those present to the absent monks who have not announced their purity.
And announce what has been announced.

original: ko bhikṣu bhikṣuṇīnāṃ chandahārako tenotthāya vṛddhāntaṃ āruhya vaktavyaṃ /
analyzed: kaḥ bhikṣu bhikṣuṇīnām tena utthāya vṛddhāntam āruhya vaktavyam
translated: Which monk will bring the consent of the nuns? He should rise up, go to the end of the elders, and say:

original: vandāmy āryasaṃghaṃ samagro hi bhikṣuṇīsaṃgho samagrasya pādāṃ śirasā vandati /
analyzed: vandāmi ārya saṃgham samagraḥ hi bhikṣuṇī saṃghaḥ samagrasya śirasā vandati
translated: I pay homage to the noble Saṅgha. The Saṅgha of nuns is complete, and it pays homage with its head at the feet of the complete (Saṅgha of monks).
And it requests instruction.
And it accepts the poṣadha.

original: evaṃ dvitīyam pi tṛtīyam pi vaktavyaṃ /
translated: Thus he should speak a second and a third time.

original: yadi tahiṃ bhikṣuṇītovādako sammatako bhavati vaktavyo / ovādāhīti /
analyzed: yadi tahim bhikṣuṇītovādakaḥ sammatakaḥ bhavati vaktavyaḥ
translated: If there is a monk there who is agreed upon as the instructor of nuns, he should be told: Give the instruction.

original: atha dāni na kocid bhikṣuṇīyovādako bhavati tatra yo dvādaśehi aṅgehi samanvāgato bhavati so sammanyitavyo /
analyzed: atha dāni na kocid bhikṣuṇīyovādakaḥ bhavati tatra yaḥ dvādaśehi aṅgehi samanvāgataḥ bhavati saḥ sammanyitavyaḥ
translated: But if there is no monk at all who instructs the nuns, then one who is endowed with twelve qualities should be fully ordained.
With which twelve?
Namely:

analyzed: prātimokṣa samvara samvṛtaḥ viharati ācāra gocara sampannaḥ
translated: He lives restrained by the restraint of the Prātimokṣa, endowed with proper conduct and resort,

original: anumātreṣv avadyeṣu bhayadarśī samādāya śikṣitaśikṣāpadeṣu kāyakarmavākkarmaṇā sammanvāgataḥ /
analyzed: anumātreṣu avadyeṣu bhaya darśī samādāya śikṣita śikṣā padeṣu kāya karma vāc karmaṇā sammanvāgataḥ
translated: seeing danger in the slightest faults, undertaking the training rules, and being endowed with bodily and verbal actions.
He has a pure livelihood.

original: bahuśrutaś ca abhidharme bahusrutaś ca bhavaty abhivinaye partibalo ca bhavaty adhiśīlaśikṣāyām vinayituṃ / ṇka /
analyzed: bahuśrutaḥ ca abhidharme bahusrutaḥ ca bhavati abhivinaye ca bhavati adhi śīla śikṣāyām vinayitum
translated: He is learned, and is learned in the Abhidharma and the Vinaya, and is able to instruct in the training of higher morality.

original: pratibalo bhavaty adhicittaṃ śikṣāyāṃ vinayituṃ / tṛ /
translated: He is able to instruct in the training of higher thought.

analyzed: pratibalaḥ bhavati adhiprajñām śikṣāyām vinayitum  phu
translated: He is able to instruct in the training of higher wisdom.

analyzed: an anudhvasta brahmacaryaḥ ca bhavati  grā  yaḥ bhūya kṣānti jātikaḥ bhavati
translated: He is not one whose celibacy is broken.
He is one who is mostly patient.

original: na ca bhikṣuṇīnāṃ gurudharmaṃ āpadyitā bhavati /
analyzed: na ca bhikṣuṇīnām guru dharmam āpadyitā bhavati
translated: He is not one who has incurred a grave offense against a nun.

original: to kalyāṇavacanaś ca bhavati kalyāṇavākkaraṇopetaś ca bhavati /
analyzed: kalyāṇa vacanaḥ ca bhavati kalyāṇa vāc karaṇa upetaḥ ca bhavati
translated: He is one who speaks well, and he is endowed with a pleasant voice.

original: pauryavācā samanvāgato vispaṣṭāya anelāya arthasya vijñāpanīya /
analyzed: paurya vācā samanvāgataḥ vispaṣṭāya an elāya arthasya vijñāpanīya
translated: He is endowed with a pure voice, which is clear, pleasant, and conveys the meaning.

analyzed: ca bhavati sa atirekaviṃśati varṣaḥ vā
translated: He is twenty years old or more than twenty years old.

original: imehi dvādaśehi aṅgehi samanvāgato bhikṣuṇīovādaka sammutīya saṃmanyitavyo /
translated: A monk who is endowed with these twelve qualities should be agreed upon as an instructor of nuns.
The one who performs the proclamation should perform the proclamation.

original: śṛṇotu me bhante saṃgho ayam itthannāmo ti bhikṣur aṅgopeto /
analyzed: śṛṇotu me bhante saṃghaḥ ayam itthannāmaḥ ti bhikṣuḥ aṅga upetaḥ
translated: Venerable Saṅgha, please listen. This monk so-and-so is endowed with the qualities.

original: yadi saṃghasya prāptakālaṃ saṃgho itthannāmaṃ bhikṣuṃ bhikṣuṇītovādakaṃ saṃmutīya saṃmanyeya ovayikā eṣā jñaptiḥ /
analyzed: yadi saṃghasya prāpta kālam saṃghaḥ itthannāmam bhikṣum bhikṣuṇītovādakam saṃmutīya saṃmanyeya ovayikā eṣā jñaptiḥ
translated: If it is the right time for the Saṅgha, the Saṅgha should agree upon the monk so-and-so as an instructor of nuns. This is the motion.

original: śṛṇotu me bhante saṃgho ayam itthannāmo bhikṣur taṃ saṃgho itthannāmaṃ bhikṣuṃ bhikṣuṇīovādakaṃ saṃmutīya sammanyati /
analyzed: śṛṇotu me bhante saṃghaḥ ayam itthannāmaḥ bhikṣuḥ tam saṃghaḥ itthannāmam bhikṣum bhikṣuṇī ovādakam saṃmutīya sammanyati
translated: Venerable Saṅgha, please listen. This monk so-and-so, the Saṅgha is agreeing upon him as an instructor of nuns.

original: yeṣām āyuṣmantānāṃ kṣamati itthannāmaṃ bhikṣuṃ bhikṣuṇīovādakaṃ saṃmutīya sammanyiyamānaṃ saṃghena /🔽so tūṣṇīm asya /
analyzed: yeṣām āyuṣmantānām kṣamati itthannāmam bhikṣum bhikṣuṇīovādakam saṃmutīya sammanyiyamānam saṃghena 🔽sā u tūṣṇīm asya
translated: Those venerable ones who agree that the monk so-and-so should be agreed upon as an instructor of nuns, they should remain silent.
He who does not approve, let him speak.

original: iyaṃ prathamā karmavācanā evaṃ dvitīya tṛtīyā karmavācaneti /
analyzed: iyam prathamā karma vācanā evam dvitīya tṛtīyā karma vācanā iti
translated: This is the first proclamation of the act. In the same way, there is a second and a third proclamation of the act.

original: sammato bhante saṃgho itthannāmo bhikṣuḥ bhikṣuṇīovādaka saṃmutīya saṃghena /
analyzed: sammataḥ bhante saṃghaḥ itthannāmaḥ bhikṣuḥ bhikṣuṇī ovādaka saṃmutīya saṃghena
translated: The Saṅgha has approved the monk so-and-so as an instructor of the nuns by a unanimous Saṅgha.

original: kṣamate taṃ saṃghasya yasmāt tūṣṇīm evam etaṃ dhārayāmi /🔽tena dāni sammatena samānena tāyo bhikṣuṇīyo ovāditavyāyo nākāle nādeśe /
analyzed: kṣamate tam saṃghasya yasmāt tūṣṇīm evam etam dhārayāmi  tena dāni sammatena samānena tāyaḥ bhikṣuṇīyaḥ ovāditavyāyaḥ na akāle na ādeśe
translated: Since the Saṅgha has approved it, it is to be regarded as approved by the Saṅgha, because of its silence.
Then, having been approved and appointed, those nuns are to be instructed by him, not at the wrong time, not in a secluded place,

analyzed: na atikrānte kāle  na chandaśas  na vyagraśas
translated: not in the future,🔽not in the past,🔽not by choice,🔽not by a group,
not by a circle,
not with long speeches.
When he wishes to come, he should be sent for.

original: kin ti dāni nākālo /🔽akālo nāma astamito sūryo /
analyzed: kim ti dāni na akālaḥ  akālaḥ nāma astamitaḥ sūryaḥ
translated: Now, what is the wrong time?🔽The wrong time is when the sun has set,
when it is dark, when the dawn has disappeared.

original: kin ti dāni nādeśe /🔽adeśo nāma veśikāsāmante vā dūdyū
analyzed: kim ti dāni nādeśe  adeśaḥ nāma veśikā sāmante vā dūdyū
translated: Now, what is a secluded place?🔽A secluded place is one that is near a brothel,

analyzed: takara śālā sāmante vā  pāna āgāra śālā sāmante vā
translated: near a gambling house,🔽near a drinking house,

original: vadhabandhanāgāraśālāsāmante vā atibhūṇḍe vā atiprākaṭe vā pradeśe /
analyzed: vadha bandhana āgāra śālā sāmante vā ati bhūṇḍe vā ati prākaṭe vā pradeśe
translated: near a prison, near a place that is too crowded, or too exposed.

original: kin ti dāni nānāgate kāle anāgato nāma kālo pratipade dvitīyāyām vā /
analyzed: kim ti dāni na anāgate kāle anāgataḥ nāma kālaḥ pratipade dvitīyāyām vā
translated: What is meant by ‘not in the future’? The future time is the second day or the third day.

analyzed: kim ti dāni na atikrānte kāle
translated: What is meant by ‘not in the past’?

original: atikrānto nāma kālo caturdaśīyām vā pañcadaśīyām vā /
analyzed: atikrāntaḥ nāma kālo caturdaśīyām vā pañcadaśīyām vā
translated: The past time is the fourteenth day or the fifteenth day.

original: atha khu tṛtīyāprabhṛti tāvad ovaditavyā yāvat trayodaśīti /
analyzed: atha khu tṛtīyā prabhṛti tāvat ovaditavyā yāvat trayodaśī iti
translated: But from the third day onwards, she may be instructed up until the thirteenth day.
What is meant by ‘not by choice’?
The instruction should be given by the nuns to the nun who is the instructor.
But all of them should come.
What is meant by ‘not in a divided assembly’?

analyzed: na bhikṣuṇā vyagraḥ bhikṣuṇī saṃghaḥ ovaditavyaḥ
translated: The assembly of nuns should not be instructed by a divided assembly of monks.
But all of them should be instructed together.
What is meant by ‘not by a group’?

original: na tāvat tava parṣā ovaditavyā tavādya parṣāye ovādakavāro tavādya parṣāye ovādakavāro ti /
analyzed: na tāvat tava parṣā ovaditavyā tava adya parṣāye ovādaka vāraḥ tava adya parṣāye ovādaka vāraḥ ti
translated: The assembly should not be instructed by your group. Today is the turn of the instructor for your assembly. Today is the turn of the instructor for your assembly.’
But all of them should be instructed together.

original: kin ti dāni na dīrghovādena ovaditāḥ /
analyzed: kim ti dāni na dīrghovādena ovaditāḥ
translated: What is meant by ‘not by a long discourse’?
But they should be instructed in brief.

analyzed: sarva pāpasya a karaṇam kuśalasya upasampadā
translated: Not doing any evil, cultivating the wholesome,🔽purifying one’s own mind—this is the teaching of the Buddhas.

analyzed: sva citta paryodavanam etat buddha anuśāsanam ti
translated: This is the end of the instruction of one’s own mind, the teaching of the Buddha.”

original: eṣa bhaginīyo ovādo śiṣṭakaṃ parikathā bhaviṣyati /
translated: This, Noble Lady, is the instruction. The rest is a mere explanation.
If she wishes to come, let her come.
If she wishes to listen, let her listen.
What should be sent to one who wishes to come?

original: yadi śosobhikṣuṇīovādako deśāntaraṅ gato bhavati tato ye tasya sārdhevihārikāvā antevāsikā bhavanti te bhikṣunīsaṃghena utsāhayitavyāḥ
analyzed: yadi śosaḥ bhikṣuṇīovādakaḥ deśa antaram gataḥ bhavati tatas ye tasya antevāsikāḥ bhavanti te bhikṣunī saṃghena utsāhayitavyāḥ
translated: If the instructor monk has gone to another country, then those who are his companions in the religious life and disciples should be encouraged by the community of nuns.
“Go and bring the almsbowl and robes of the Noble One.”
When they are going and coming,

analyzed: ntānām ca pathi adanena a vaikalyam kartavyam
translated: they should not be lacking in provisions on the road.

original: āgacchantasya bhikṣuṇīsaṃghena chatradhvajapatākehi yojanaṃ panthasya pratyudgantavyaṃ /
analyzed: āgacchantasya bhikṣuṇī saṃghena chatra dhvaja patākehi yojanam panthasya pratyudgantavyam
translated: When he comes, he should be met on the road for a distance of one yojana by the community of nuns with umbrellas, banners, and flags.

original: yaṃhi vihāre avatarāya taṃhi ubhayasaṃghasya saptāhaṃ bhaktaṃ kartavyaṃ /
analyzed: yaṃhi vihāre avatarāya taṃhi ubhaya saṃghasya sapta aham bhaktam kartavyam
translated: When he enters the monastery, a meal should be provided for the community of both orders for seven days.

original: atha dāni daridro bhikṣuṇīsaṃgho bhavati bhikṣusaṃghasyaiva saptāhaṃ bhaktaṃ kartavyaṃ /
analyzed: atha dāni daridraḥ bhikṣuṇī saṃghaḥ bhavati bhikṣu saṃghasya eva sapta aham bhaktam kartavyam
translated: But if the community of nuns is poor, a meal should be provided for the community of monks for seven days.

original: antamasato ekapiṇḍapātenāpi pratimānayitavyo tena dāni bhikṣuṇīovādakena bhikṣuṇīhi dhītāsaṃjñā upasthāpayitavyā /
analyzed: antam asataḥ eka piṇḍapātena api pratimānayitavyaḥ tena dāni bhikṣuṇīovādakena bhikṣuṇīhi dhītā saṃjñā upasthāpayitavyā
translated: At least he should be honored with a single alms-meal. Then, by that monk instructor of nuns, the nuns should be treated as if they were his daughters.

original: tāhi bhikṣuṇīhi tasmin bhikṣuṇīovādakehi pitṛsaṃjñā upasthāpayitavyā /
analyzed: tāhi bhikṣuṇīhi tasmin bhikṣuṇīovādakehi pitṛ saṃjñā upasthāpayitavyā
translated: By those nuns, that monk instructor of nuns should be treated as if he were their father.

original: na kṣamati tena bhikṣuṇīovādakena ghoṭena yathā prasārya grīvāṃ tāyo bhikṣuṇīyo ovādituṃ /
analyzed: na kṣamati tena bhikṣuṇīovādakena ghoṭena yathā prasārya grīvām tāyaḥ bhikṣuṇīyaḥ ovāditum
translated: It is not allowable for that monk instructor of nuns to instruct the nuns while standing as far apart as he likes to stretch out his neck.

original: atha khalu yugamātraṃ nirīkṣante na tāyo ovāditavyāyo /
translated: But rather, he should look at them as far as a yoke’s length. Those nuns should not be instructed.

original: yadi kadācit tahiṃ bhavet keśāvartena vā kṛtena /🔽akṣīhi vā añcitena ākoṭitamaṣṭehi vā cīvarehi /🔽śvetena vā kāya bandhanena /
analyzed: yadi kadācid bhavet keśa āvartena vā kṛtena  vā añcitena ākoṭitam aṣṭehi vā cīvarehi  śvetena vā kāya bandhanena
translated: If it should happen that there is a hair-ringlet there,🔽or the eyes are painted, or the earrings are hanging, or the robes are tucked in,🔽or a white head-covering,
or variegated sandals,
it is not allowable to overlook it.
If she is a young girl, she should be admonished.

original: he avyakte akuśale idānīṃ tvaṃ nena
analyzed: he avyakte akuśale idānīm tvam nena
translated: ‘Unseemly, unskilful, now you have

original: śikṣasi kadā śikṣiṣyasi yaṃ kālaṃ jīrṇavṛddhā mahallikā adhvagatavayam anuprāptā bhaviṣyasi yā pi tavaiṣā parṣā sā pi tava dṛṣṭvā anukṛtim
analyzed: śikṣasi kadā śikṣiṣyasi yam kālam jīrṇa vṛddhā mahallikā adhva gata vayam anuprāptā bhaviṣyasi yā pi tava eṣā parṣā sā pi tava dṛṣṭvā anukṛtim
translated: When will you train? When you have become old, aged, and decrepit, and have reached the end of your life, then you will train. And your assembly, seeing you, will follow your example,

original: āpadyamānā anayena vyasanam āpadyiṣyati /🔽etaṃ tava sādhu etat pratirūpaṃ yayaṃ
analyzed: āpadyamānā anayena vyasanam āpadyiṣyati  etam tava sādhu etat pratirūpam yayam
translated: and will fall into misfortune through this wrong course.🔽It would be good for you,

original: tvaṃ bhadrikā guṇavatī śikṣākāmā bhavesi buddhānāṃ śāsane yogam āpadyesi /
analyzed: tvam bhadrikā guṇavatī śikṣā kāmā bhavesi buddhānām śāsane yogam āpadyesi
translated: it would be fitting for you, if you were to be virtuous, endowed with good qualities, and desirous of training, and apply yourself to the teaching of the Buddhas.

original: atha dāni sā vṛddhā bhavati vaktavyaṃ /
analyzed: atha dāni sā vṛddhā bhavati vaktavyam
translated: If she is old, then she should be told:

original: sālohite idānīṃ īdṛśī kīdṛśī tvam āsi taruṇe kāle idānīṃ tvaṃ na śikṣasi kadā śikṣiṣyasi /
analyzed: sālohite idānīm īdṛśī kīdṛśī tvam āsi taruṇe kāle idānīm tvam na śikṣasi kadā śikṣiṣyasi
translated: Venerable lady, now that you are like this, what were you like in your youth? Now you do not train, when will you train?🔽When you have reached the threshold of the womb, and your assembly, seeing you, will follow your example,

original: yaṃ kālaṃ maṇḍaladvāram anuprāptā bhaviṣyasi yāpi tava eṣa parṣā sāpi tava dṛṣṭvā nukṛtim āpadyamānā anayā vyasanam āpatsyati etat tava 🔽sādhu etaṃ pratirūpaṃ yayaṃ
analyzed: yam kālam maṇḍala dvāram anuprāptā bhaviṣyasi yā api tava eṣa parṣā sā api tava dṛṣṭvā nukṛtim āpadyamānā anayā vyasanam āpatsyati etat tava  / sādhu etam pratirūpam yayam
translated: and will fall into misfortune through this wrong course. It would be good for you,

original: tvaṃ bhadrikā guṇavatī śikṣākāmā bhavesi buddhānāṃ śāsane yogam āpadyesi /
analyzed: tvam bhadrikā guṇavatī śikṣā kāmā bhavesi buddhānām śāsane yogam āpadyesi
translated: it would be fitting for you, if you were to be virtuous, endowed with good qualities, and desirous of training, and apply yourself to the teaching of the Buddhas.

original: atha dāni so bhikṣuṇīyovādako gocaraprasṛto rathyāyaṃ bhikṣuṇīn paśyati keśāvartena vā kṛtena /
analyzed: atha dāni saḥ bhikṣuṇīya uvādakaḥ gocara prasṛtaḥ bhikṣuṇīn paśyati keśa āvartena vā kṛtena
translated: Now, if the monk who instructs the nuns, while out on his alms round, sees nuns on the street with their hair in a topknot,
with their eyes painted,
with their robes tucked in,
with a white sash,

original: citrakūṭāhi vā upānahāhi na dāni kṣamati nahi kīñcij jalpituṃ /
analyzed: vai upānahāhi na dāni kṣamati nahi kīñcid jalpitum
translated: with colorful sandals, then he should not say anything,

original: mā jano ojjhāpeya paśyatha bhaṇe śramaṇako bhāryām iva śravaṇikām ovadasiti /
analyzed: mā paśyatha bhaṇe śramaṇakaḥ bhāryām iva śravaṇikām ovadasiti
translated: lest people should criticize, saying, “Look, the ascetic is instructing his wife, his mistress, as it were.”
But he should rather ask,

original: katamahiṃ eṣā vihārake prativasati /🔽kā se upādhyāyī /
analyzed: eṣā vihārake prativasati  kā se upādhyāyī
translated: “In which dwelling does she live?”🔽“Who is her preceptor?”

original: kā se ācāryā paścād uktaṃ tahiṃ gatvā ovaditayvā /
analyzed: kā se ācāryā paścāt uktam tahim gatvā
translated: “Who is her teacher?” Then, after going there, he should instruct her.

original: sā eṣā bhikṣuṇī avajñāya vā paribhavena vā koṇṭabhikṣū ti vā kṛtvā /
analyzed: sā eṣā bhikṣuṇī avajñāya vā paribhavena vā koṇṭabhikṣū ti vā kṛtvā
translated: If that nun, out of contempt or disrespect, or thinking, “He is a monk who has fallen on hard times,”

original: vaidyabhikṣū ti vā kṛtvā cūḍabhikṣū ti vā kṛtvā /
analyzed: vaidya bhikṣū ti vā kṛtvā cūḍa bhikṣū ti vā kṛtvā
translated: or thinking, “He is a monk who is a doctor,” or thinking, “He is a monk who is a barber,”

original: akhallamahallaakuśalaaprakṛtijño ti vā kṛtvā anvārdhamāsaṃ bhikṣusaṃghāto ovādopasaṃkramaṇaṃ na pratyāśaṃsati gurudharmam atikramati
analyzed: a khalla mahalla a kuśala a prakṛti jñaḥ ti vā kṛtvā bhikṣu saṃghātaḥ ovāda upasaṃkramaṇam na pratyāśaṃsati guru dharmam atikramati
translated: or thinking, “He is unskilled, ignorant of the rules and the code of discipline,” does not go to the community of monks for instruction every half-month, she commits an offense entailing confession when she has made up her mind and is determined to refuse, but does not commit an offense entailing confession if she is unable to go.

original: evaṃ gautami anvardhamāsaṃ bhikṣuṇīhi bhikṣusaṃghāto ovādopasaṃkramaṇaṃ pratyāśaṃsitavyaṃ /
analyzed: evam gautami anvardha māsam bhikṣuṇīhi bhikṣu saṃghātaḥ ovāda upasaṃkramaṇam pratyāśaṃsitavyam
translated: In this way, Gautami, the nuns should expect to approach the community of monks every half month for instruction.
If she does not expect it, she commits a serious offense.

original: ayaṃ gautami bhikṣuṇīnāṃ ṣaṣṭo gurudharmo yo bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvaṃ satkartavyo yāvad anatikramaṇīyo velāmiva mahāsamudreṇa /
analyzed: ayam gautami bhikṣuṇīnām ṣaṣṭaḥ guru dharmaḥ yaḥ bhikṣuṇīhi yāvajjīvam satkartavyaḥ yāvat an atikramaṇīyaḥ velām iva mahā samudreṇa
translated: This, Gautami, is the sixty-first rule for nuns, which should be honored, respected, revered, venerated, and not transgressed as long as she lives, just as the great ocean does not transgress the shoreline.
Serious offense

original: kin ti dāni na kṣamati bhikṣuṇīhi abhikṣuke avāse varṣām upagantuṃ /
analyzed: kim ti dāni na kṣamati bhikṣuṇīhi abhikṣuke a vāse varṣām upagantum
translated: Now, what is not allowed for nuns to enter the rainy season in a place without monks?

original: na kṣamati bhikṣuṇīhi abhikṣukehi grāmanagarehi varṣām upagantuṃ /
analyzed: na kṣamati bhikṣuṇīhi abhikṣukehi grāma nagarehi varṣām upagantum
translated: It is not allowed for nuns to enter the rainy season in villages or towns without monks.

original: atha dāni bhikṣuṇī jñātikehi grāmavāsakehi nimantrīyati /
analyzed: atha dāni bhikṣuṇī jñātikehi grāma vāsakehi nimantrīyati
translated: But if a nun is invited by relatives to live in a village,

original: ihāryā varṣāvasāna ti na ca tahiṃ keci bhikṣū bhavanti bhikṣuṇī ca jñātikāmanukaṃpitukāmā bhavatinti vaktavyaṃ /
translated: and there are no monks there, and the nun wishes to be compassionate to her relatives, she should say,
First invite the senior assembly.

original: atha dān āhaṃsuḥ /🔽nāsti asmākaṃ tahiṃ śraddhā /
analyzed: atha dān āhaṃsuḥ  na asti asmākam tahim śraddhā
translated: Then they say,🔽We have no faith in them.
We have no confidence.
She should say,
I also do not wish to.
But if a nun is wealthy,
and if she wishes to show compassion to her relatives,
she should invite the monks herself.

original: teṣām āgatānāṃ samānānāṃ āhāreṇa avaikalyaṃ kartavyaṃ /
analyzed: teṣām āgatānām samānānām āhāreṇa a vaikalyam kartavyam
translated: When they have come and assembled, she should make sure that they are not lacking in food.
They should enter the rainy season retreat there.

original: tāya bhikṣuṇīya tahiṃ varṣām tāya bhikṣuṇīya teṣām bhikṣūṇāṃ mūle anvardhamāsaṃ ovādopasaṃkramaṇaṃ pratyāśaṃsitavyaṃ /
analyzed: tāya bhikṣuṇīya varṣām tāya bhikṣuṇīya teṣām bhikṣūṇām mūle anvardha māsam ovāda upasaṃkramaṇam pratyāśaṃsitavyam
translated: That nun should expect to go for instruction every half-month in the presence of those monks.

original: atha teṣām bhikṣūṇāṃ varṣām upagatānāṃ antaravarṣārāstuastu /
translated: But if those monks, having entered the rainy season retreat, should leave in the middle of the rainy season,
or some misfortune should arise, and they should leave,

original: na dāni kṣamati bhikṣuṇīya kahiñci gantuṃ yāvat pravāraṇākālaṃ /
analyzed: na dāni kṣamati bhikṣuṇīya kahiñci gantum yāvat pravāraṇā kālam
translated: then it is not permissible for the nun to go anywhere until the invitation ceremony.

original: yadi tāvat kṣemam bhavati tato te śabdāpayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: yadi tāvat kṣemam bhavati te śabdāpayitavyāḥ
translated: If it is safe, then they should be summoned.
But not the newly arrived ones.
Rather, those who have been mentioned should be invited.

original: āgatānāṃ samānānāṃ bhaktena pratimānīya ācchādīya yathā samvibhāgan dātavyaṃ /
analyzed: āgatānām samānānām bhaktena pratimānīya ācchādīya yathā dātavyam
translated: When they have come and assembled, she should make sure that they are not lacking in food, and she should give them robes according to their share.

original: pravārite kiñcāpi yaṃhi chando tahiṃ gacchati anāpattiḥ /🔽sā eṣā bhikṣuṇī avajñāya vā paribhavena vā koṇṭa bhikṣū ti vā kṛtvā /🔽vaidyabhikṣū ti vā kṛtvā kṛtvā cūḍabhikṣū ti vā kṛtvā khallamahallaakuśalaaprakṛtijño ti vā kṛtvā abhikṣuke āvāse varṣām upagacchati gurudharmam
analyzed: pravārite kiñca api yaṃhi chandaḥ tahim gacchati anāpattiḥ  sā eṣā bhikṣuṇī avajñāya vā paribhavena vā koṇṭa bhikṣū ti vā kṛtvā  vaidya bhikṣū ti vā kṛtvā kṛtvā cūḍa bhikṣū ti vā kṛtvā khalla mahalla a kuśala a prakṛti jñaḥ ti vā kṛtvā abhikṣuke āvāse varṣām upagacchati guru dharmam
translated: If she goes to the place where she wishes, even though she has been invited, there is no offense.

This nun, out of contempt or disrespect, or because she thinks, ‘These monks are fools,’ or ‘These monks are quacks,’ or ‘These monks are ignorant, old, unskilled, and unlearned,’ or ‘These monks are not monks,’ enters the rains residence in a monastery without monks. She transgresses a grave offense.

original: evaṃ gautami na kṣamati bhikṣunīya abhikṣuke āvāse varṣām upagantuṃ /
analyzed: evam gautami na kṣamati bhikṣunīye abhikṣuke āvāse varṣām upagantum
translated: Thus, Gautami, a nun should not enter the rains residence in a monastery without monks.

original: ayaṃ gautami bhikṣuṇīnāṃ saptamo gurudharmo yo bhikṣuṇīhi yāvaj jīvaṃ satkartavyo yāvad anatikramaṇīyo velāmiva mahāsamudreṇa /
analyzed: ayam gautami bhikṣuṇīnām saptamaḥ guru dharmaḥ yaḥ bhikṣuṇīhi yāvat jīvam satkartavyaḥ yāvat an atikramaṇīyaḥ velām iva mahā samudreṇa
translated: Gautami, this is the seventh grave offense for nuns, which should not be transgressed for life, which should not be transgressed, which is difficult to surpass, like a great abyss, namely:

original: gurudharma🔽kin ti dāni varṣoṣitāhi bhikṣuṇīhi ubhayato saṃghe pravāraṇā pratyāśaṃsitavyā /
analyzed: guru dharma  kim ti dāni varṣa uṣitāhi bhikṣuṇīhi ubhayatas saṃghe pravāraṇā pratyāśaṃsitavyā
translated: Grave offense🔽What then should nuns who have completed the rains residence do regarding the invitation ceremony in both Sanghas?

original: yadaho dāni saṃghasya pravāraṇā bhavati tadaho bhikṣuṇīhi pravārayitavyaṃ /
analyzed: yat aho dāni saṃghasya pravāraṇā bhavati tat aho bhikṣuṇīhi pravārayitavyam
translated: On the day when the Sangha’s invitation ceremony is held, the nuns should hold their invitation ceremony.

original: aparejjukāto pratipade kalyato ye ca nirdhāviya bhikṣuvihāraṃ gantavyaṃ /
analyzed: pratipade ye ca nirdhāviya bhikṣuvihāram gantavyam
translated: From the next day on, they should go to the monks' dwelling place after having left at dawn.

original: yadi tāva samagro bhikṣusaṃgho bhavati na kṣamati sarvāhi bhikṣuṇīhi apūrvācarimaṃ prāvarayituṃ /
analyzed: yadi tāva samagraḥ bhikṣu saṃghaḥ bhavati na kṣamati sarvāhi bhikṣuṇīhi prāvarayitum
translated: If the community of monks is complete, it is not allowed for all the nuns to invite [the monks] in order of seniority.
Then, a nun who is able to invite [the monks] should be appointed.
A nun who is able to invite [the monks].
Then the one who performs the duties should perform the duties.
May the noble Sangha listen to me.
This nun so-and-so is able to invite [the monks].

original: yadi saṃghasya prāptakālaṃ saṃgho itthannāmāṃ bhikṣuṇīm saṃghasya pravārāyikāṃ saṃmanyeya /
analyzed: yadi saṃghasya prāpta kālam saṃghaḥ itthannāmām bhikṣuṇīm saṃghasya pravārāyikām saṃmanyeya
translated: If it is the right time for the Sangha, the Sangha should appoint the nun so-and-so as the inviter of the Sangha.
This is the motion.

original: tuśṛṇotu me āryasaṃgho /🔽iyam itthannāmā bhikṣuṇī pratibalā pravārāyikā /
analyzed: me ārya saṃghaḥ  iyam itthannāmā bhikṣuṇī pratibalā pravārāyikā
translated: May the noble Sangha listen to me.🔽This nun so-and-so is able to invite [the monks].

original: tāṃ saṃgho itthannāmāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ saṃghasya pravārāyikāṃ saṃmanyati /
analyzed: tām saṃghaḥ itthannāmām bhikṣuṇīm saṃghasya pravārāyikām saṃmanyati
translated: The Sangha appoints the nun so-and-so as the inviter of the Sangha.

original: yāsām āryamiśrikāṇāṃ kṣamati itthannāmāṃ bhikṣuṇīṃ saṃghasya pravārāyikāṃ saṃmanyiyamānāṃ saṃghena /
analyzed: yāsām ārya miśrikāṇām kṣamati itthannāmām bhikṣuṇīm saṃghasya pravārāyikām saṃmanyiyamānām saṃghena
translated: For those noble nuns, it is allowed to appoint such-and-such a nun as the interviewer of the Sangha, who is being approved by the Sangha.
She is silent about it.
For whom it is not allowed, let her speak.
This is the first announcement of the legal procedure.

analyzed: evam dvitīyā tṛtīyā karma vācanā iti
translated: In the same way, the second and third announcements of the legal procedure should be made.
It should be said.

original: sammatā āryamiśrikāyo itthannāmā saṃghasya pravārāyikā saṃghena kṣamate taṃ saṃghasya yasmāt tūṣṇīm evaṃ dhārayāmi /
analyzed: sammatā ārya miśrikāyaḥ itthannāmā saṃghasya pravārāyikā saṃghena kṣamate tam saṃghasya yasmāt tūṣṇīm evam dhārayāmi
translated: The noble nuns have approved the appointment of such-and-such a nun as the interviewer of the Sangha. The Sangha approves, because it is silent. I will remember it thus.
Then all should stand at the end of the senior nuns.
Then the interviewer should say,

original: samagro bhikṣuṇīsaṃgho samagraṃ bhikṣusaṃghaṃ pravāreti dṛṣṭena śrutena pariśaṅkayā /
analyzed: samagraḥ bhikṣuṇī saṃghaḥ samagram bhikṣu saṃgham pravāreti dṛṣṭena śrutena pariśaṅkayā
translated: The Sangha of nuns invites the Sangha of monks to correct them, with regard to what is seen, heard, or suspected, for the sake of settling the matter.

original: ovadantu mo āryo saṃgho arthakāmo hitaiṣī anukampako anukampām upādāya jānantyo paśyantyo smarantyo yathā dharmavinayaṃ pratikariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: ovadantu mā u āryaḥ saṃghaḥ artha kāmaḥ hita eṣī anukampakaḥ anukampām upādāya jānantyaḥ paśyantyaḥ smarantyaḥ yathā dharma vinayam pratikariṣyāmaḥ
translated: May the noble Sangha of monks, desiring our welfare, wishing to be helpful, out of compassion for us, instruct us, knowing and seeing, remembering, so that we may correct our conduct according to the Dharma and the Monastic Law.
In the same way, a second and a third time.

original: atha dāni samagro bhikṣuṇīsaṃgho bhavati saṃbahulā bhikṣū bhavatinti /
analyzed: atha dāni samagraḥ bhikṣuṇī saṃghaḥ bhavati saṃbahulāḥ bhikṣū
translated: Now, if the community of nuns is complete, and there are many monks,
it should be said:

original: samagro bhikṣuṇīsaṃgho saṃbahulān bhikṣūn pravāreti dṛṣṭena śrutena yāvat pratikariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: samagraḥ bhikṣuṇī saṃghaḥ saṃbahulān bhikṣūn pravāreti dṛṣṭena śrutena yāvat pratikariṣyāmaḥ
translated: The complete community of nuns invites the many monks to speak about what they have seen, heard, or suspect, and we will make amends.
A second and a third time.

original: atha dāni samagro bhikṣuṇīsaṃgho bhavati eka bhikṣu ca bhavati /
analyzed: atha dāni samagraḥ bhikṣuṇī saṃghaḥ bhavati eka bhikṣu ca bhavati
translated: Now, if the community of nuns is complete, and there is one monk,
it should be said:

original: samagro bhikṣuṇīsaṃgho āryaṃ pravāretīti dṛṣṭena śrutena pariśaṅkayā yāvat pratikariṣyāmaḥ evaṃ dvitīyam pi tṛtīyam pi /
analyzed: samagraḥ bhikṣuṇī saṃghaḥ āryam pravāreti iti dṛṣṭena śrutena pariśaṅkayā yāvat pratikariṣyāmaḥ evam dvitīyam tṛtīyam pi
translated: The complete community of nuns invites the noble one to speak about what they have seen, heard, or suspect, and we will make amends. A second and a third time.
Now, if there are many nuns,
and the community of monks is complete,

original: vaktyavyaṃ saṃbahulāḥ āryamiśrikāḥ samagraṃ bhikṣusaṃghaṃ pravārenti dṛṣṭena śrutena pariśaṅkayā yāvat pratikariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: saṃbahulāḥ āryamiśrikāḥ samagram bhikṣu saṃgham pravārenti dṛṣṭena śrutena pariśaṅkayā yāvat pratikariṣyāmaḥ
translated: it should be said: The many noble nuns invite the complete community of monks to speak about what they have seen, heard, or suspect, and we will make amends.
A second and a third time.

original: atha dāni saṃbahulā ca bhikṣuṇīyo bhavanti saṃbahulā ca bhikṣu bhavanti /
analyzed: atha dāni saṃbahulā ca bhikṣuṇīyaḥ bhavanti saṃbahulā ca bhikṣu bhavanti
translated: Now, if there are many nuns and many monks,
It should be said:

original: saṃbahulā āryamiśrikāḥ saṃbahulān āryamiśrān pravārenti dṛṣṭena śrutena pariśaṅkayā yāvad /
analyzed: saṃbahulāḥ āryamiśrikāḥ saṃbahulān āryamiśrān pravārenti dṛṣṭena śrutena pariśaṅkayā yāvat
translated: Many noble nuns should invite many noble monks, with what has been seen, heard, or suspected, up to:

original: yathā dharmaṃ yathā vinayaṃ tathā pratikariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: yathā dharmam yathā vinayam tathā pratikariṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will act according to the Dharma and according to the Vinaya.
So a second and a third time.
Now if there are many nuns,
and there is one monk,
it should be said:

original: saṃbahulā āryamiśrikāḥ āryaṃ pravārenti dṛṣṭena śrutena pariśaṅkayā yāvad yathā dharmaṃ yathā vinayaṃ tathā pratikariṣyāmāḥ /
analyzed: saṃbahulāḥ āryamiśrikāḥ āryam dṛṣṭena śrutena pariśaṅkayā yāvat yathā dharmam yathā vinayam tathā pratikariṣyāmaḥ
translated: Many noble nuns invite the noble one, with what has been seen, heard, or suspected, up to: We will act according to the Dharma and according to the Vinaya.

original: evaṃ dvitīyam pi tṛtīyam pi /🔽atha dāni ekakā
analyzed: evam dvitīyam tṛtīyam  atha dāni ekakā
translated: So a second and a third time.
Now if there is one nun,
and the Saṅgha is complete,
it should be said:

original: aham itthannāmā saṃghaṃ pravāremi dṛṣṭena śrutena pariśaṅkayā /
analyzed: aham itthannāmā saṃgham pravāremi dṛṣṭena śrutena pariśaṅkayā
translated: I, named so-and-so, invite the Saṅgha with what has been seen, heard, or suspected.

original: ovadatu mo āryo saṃgho yāvat pratikariṣyāmi evaṃ dvitīyam pi tṛtīyam pi /🔽atha dāni ekakā
analyzed: ovadatu mā u āryaḥ saṃghaḥ yāvat pratikariṣyāmi evam dvitīyam tṛtīyam  atha dāni ekakā
translated: May the noble Saṅgha instruct me, up to: I will act according to the Dharma and according to the Vinaya. So a second and a third time.
Now if there is one nun,
and there are many monks,
it should be said:

original: aham ithannāmā saṃbahulān āryamiśrān pravāremi dṛṣṭena śrutena pariśaṅkayā /
analyzed: aham ithannāmā saṃbahulān āryamiśrān pravāremi dṛṣṭena śrutena pariśaṅkayā
translated: I, so-and-so, accuse many noble ones of a mixture of (offenses) of what has been seen, heard, or suspected.

original: ovadantu me āryamiśrā yāvad yathādharmaṃ pratikariṣyāmi /
analyzed: ovadantu me ārya miśrāḥ yāvat yathādharmam pratikariṣyāmi
translated: May the noble ones of a mixture (of offenses) instruct me, as I will make amends according to the rule.

original: evaṃ dvitīyam pi tṛtīyam pi /🔽atha dāni ekakā
